title: LwM2M JSON Schema
description: JSON schema for expressing LwM2M resources as JSON

6.title: Location
6.description: This LwM2M Object provides a range of location telemetry related information which can be queried by the LwM2M Server. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: false Mandatory: false

0.title: Latitude
0.description: The decimal notation of latitude, e.g. -43.5723 [World Geodetic System 1984]. Units: lat.

1.title: Longitude
1.description: The decimal notation of longitude, e.g. 153.21760 [World Geodetic System 1984]. Units: lon.

2.title: Altitude
2.description: The decimal notation of altitude in meters above sea level. Units: m.

3.title: Radius
3.description: The value in this resource indicates the radius of a circular area in meters. The circular area is used to describe uncertainty about a point for coordinates in a two-dimensional coordinate reference systems (CRS). The center point of a circular area is specified by using the Latitude and the Longitude Resources. Units: m.

4.title: Velocity
4.description: The velocity of the LwM2M Client, as defined in [3GPP-TS_23.032].

5.title: Timestamp
5.description: The timestamp of when the location measurement was performed. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

6.title: Speed
6.description: Speed is the time rate of change in position of a LwM2M Client without regard for direction: the scalar component of velocity. Units: m/s.

7.title: Connectivity Statistics
7.description: This LwM2M Objects enables client to collect statistical information and enables the LwM2M Server to retrieve these information, set the collection duration and reset the statistical parameters. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: false Mandatory: false

0.title: SMS Tx Counter
0.description: Indicate the total number of SMS successfully transmitted during the collection period.

1.title: SMS Rx Counter
1.description: Indicate the total number of SMS successfully received during the collection period.

2.title: Tx Data
2.description: Indicate the total amount of data (IP / non-IP) transmitted during the collection period expressed in kilobytes.

3.title: Rx Data
3.description: Indicate the total amount of data (IP / non-IP) received during the collection period expressed in kilobytes.

4.title: Max Message Size
4.description: The maximum IP message size that is used during the collection period. Units: B.

5.title: Average Message Size
5.description: The average IP message size that is used during the collection period. Units: B.

8.title: Collection Period
8.description: The default collection period in seconds. The value 0 indicates that the collection period is not set. Units: s.

8.title: Lock and Wipe
8.description: This LWM2M objects provides the resources needed to perform the lock and wipe operations. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: false Mandatory: false

0.title: State
0.description:
State of the device:
0: unlocked state Normal operation.
1: partially locked state
To render the device inoperable the device has been partially locked. The "lock target" resource allows specifying the target(s) for this operation.
2: fully locked state
To render the device fully inoperable the device has been fully locked.

1.title: Lock target
1.description: To specify one or several targets for the lock operation. This allows partially locking the device by selecting specific components or interfaces to be locked.

2.title: Wipe item
2.description: Indicates which data can be wiped from the device. This resource could be e.g. representing a directory.

4.title: Wipe target
4.description: To specify one or several targets for the wipe operation. This allows selecting specific data, or, memory areas for the wipe operation.

5.title: Lock or Wipe Operation Result
5.description:
Contains the result of a lock and wipe operation
0: Default
1: Partially Lock operation successful
2: Fully Lock operation successful
3: Unlock operation successful
4: Wipe operation successful
5: Partially Lock operation failed
6: Fully Lock operation failed
7: Unlock operation failed 
8: Wipe operation failed
This Resource MAY be reported by sending Observe operation.

9.title: LWM2M Software Management
9.description: This LwM2M objects provides the resources needed to perform software management on the device. Each software component is managed via a dedicated Software Management Object instance. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: LWM2M Software Management
items.description: This LwM2M objects provides the resources needed to perform software management on the device. Each software component is managed via a dedicated Software Management Object instance. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.title: PkgName
0.description: Name of the software package

1.title: PkgVersion
1.description: Version of the software package

2.title: Package
2.description:
Software package
The package can be in one single software component, or any delivery material used by the Device to determine the software component(s) and proceed to their installation.
Can be archive file, executable, manifest. This resource to be used when it is single block of delivery.

3.title: Package URI
3.description:
URI from where the device can download the software package by an alternative mechanism. As soon the device has received the Package URI it performs the download at the next practical opportunity.
Can be direct link to a single software component or link to archive file, executable, or manifest, used by the Device to determine, then access to the software component(s). This resource to be used when it is single block of delivery.

5.title: Checkpoint
5.description: Link to a "Checkpoint" object which allows to specify conditions/dependencies for a software update. E.g. power connected, sufficient memory, target system.

7.title: Update State
7.description:
Indicates current state with respect to this software update. This value is set by the LwM2M Client.
0: INITIAL
Before downloading.
(see 5.1.2.1)
1: DOWNLOAD STARTED
The downloading process has started and is on-going.
(see 5.1.2.2)
2: DOWNLOADED
The package has been completely downloaded 
(see 5.1.2.3)
3: DELIVERED
In that state, the package has been correctly downloaded and is ready to be installed. 
(see 5.1.2.4)
If executing the Install Resource failed, the state remains at DELIVERED.
If executing the Install Resource was successful, the state changes from DELIVERED to INSTALLED.
After executing the UnInstall Resource, the state changes to INITIAL.
4: INSTALLED
In that state the software is correctly installed and can be activated or deactivated according to the Activation State Machine.
(see 5.1.2.5)

8.title: Update Supported Objects
8.description:
If this value is true, the LwM2M Client MUST inform the registered LwM2M Servers of Objects and Object Instances parameter by sending an Update or Registration message after the software update operation at the next practical opportunity if supported Objects in the LwM2M Client have changed, in order for the LwM2M Servers to promptly manage newly installed Objects. 
If false, Objects and Object Instances parameter MUST be reported at the next periodic Update message.
The default value is false.

9.title: Update Result
9.description:
Contains the result of downloading or installing/uninstalling the software
0: Initial value. Prior to download any new package in the Device, Update Result MUST be reset to this initial value. One side effect of executing the Uninstall resource is to reset Update Result to this initial value "0".
1: Downloading. The package downloading process is on-going.
2: Software successfully installed.
3: Successfully Downloaded and package integrity verified
(( 4-49, for expansion, of other scenarios))
50: Not enough storage for the new software package.
51: Out of memory during downloading process.
52: Connection lost during downloading process.
53: Package integrity check failure.
54: Unsupported package type.
56: Invalid URI
57: Device defined update error
58: Software installation failure
59: Uninstallation Failure during forUpdate(arg=0)
60-200 : (for expansion, selection to be in blocks depending on new introduction of features)
This Resource MAY be reported by sending Observe operation.

12.title: Activation State
12.description:
Indicates the current activation state of this software:
0: DISABLED
Activation State is DISABLED if the Software Activation State Machine is in the INACTIVE state or not alive.
1: ENABLED
Activation State is ENABLED only if the Software Activation State Machine is in the ACTIVE state

13.title: Package Settings
13.description:
Link to "Package Settings" object which allows to modify at any time software configuration settings. This is an application specific object. 
Note: OMA might provide a template for a Package Settings object in a future release of this specification.

14.title: User Name
14.description:
User Name for access to SW Update Package in pull mode.
Key based mechanism can alternatively use for talking to the component server instead of user name and password combination.

15.title: Password
15.description: Password for access to SW Update Package in pull mode.

16.title: Status Reason
16.description: Contains the status of the actions done by the client on the SW Component(s) referred by the present SW Update Package. The status is defined in Appendix B.

17.title: Software Component Link
17.description: Reference to SW Components downloaded and installed in scope of the present SW Update Package Note: When resource 17 objlink exist, resources 2, 3 and 12 in this table are ignored.

18.title: Software Component tree length
18.description: Software Component tree length indicates the number of instances existing for this software package in the Software Component Object.

14.title: LWM2M Software Component
14.description: If some Objects are not supported after software update, the LwM2M Client MUST delete all the Object Instances of the Objects that are not supported. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: LWM2M Software Component
items.description: If some Objects are not supported after software update, the LwM2M Client MUST delete all the Object Instances of the Objects that are not supported. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.title: Component Identity
0.description: Name or identifier of the software component

1.title: Component Pack
1.description: Software components is stored in this resource

2.title: Component Version
2.description: Version of the software component.

5.title: Activation State
5.description:
Indicates the current activation state of this software component:
0: DISABLED
Activation State is DISABLED if the Software Component Activation State Machine is in the INACTIVE state or not alive.
1: ENABLED
Activation State is ENABLED only if the Software Component Activation State Machine is in the ACTIVE state.

16.title: Portfolio
16.description: The Portfolio Object allows to extend the data storage capability of other Object Instances in the LwM2M system, as well as the services which may be used to authenticate and to protect privacy of data contained in those extensions. In addition, a service of data encryption is also defined LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Portfolio
items.description: The Portfolio Object allows to extend the data storage capability of other Object Instances in the LwM2M system, as well as the services which may be used to authenticate and to protect privacy of data contained in those extensions. In addition, a service of data encryption is also defined LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.title: Identity
0.description:
Data Storage extension for other Object Instances. 
 e.g  for [GSMA]  : 
0 : Host Device ID, 
1:  Host Device Manufacturer
2:  Host Device Model
3:  Host Device Software Version,

This Resource contains data that the GetAuthData executable Resource can work with.

2.title: AuthData
2.description: Buffer which contains the data generated by the  process triggered by a GetAuthData request

3.title: AuthStatus
3.description:
This Resource contains the state related to the process triggered by GetAuthData  request.
0 :  IDLE_STATE :  AuthData doesnâ€™t contain any valid data
1 :  DATA_AVAIL_STATE : AuthData  contains a valid data 
2 :  ERROR_STATE :  an error occurred  
This state is reset to IDLE_STATE, when the executable resource "GetAuthData" is triggered or when the AuthData resource has been returned to the LwM2M Server (READ / NOTIFY) .

19.title: BinaryAppDataContainer
19.description:
This LwM2M Objects provides the application service data related to a LwM2M Server, eg. Water meter data. 
There are several methods to create instance to indicate the message direction based on the negotiation between Application and LwM2M. The Client and Server should negotiate the instance(s) used to exchange the data. For example:
 - Using a single instance for both directions communication, from Client to Server and from Server to Client.
 - Using an instance for communication from Client to Server and another one for communication from Server to Client
 - Using several instances
 LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: BinaryAppDataContainer
items.description:
This LwM2M Objects provides the application service data related to a LwM2M Server, eg. Water meter data. 
There are several methods to create instance to indicate the message direction based on the negotiation between Application and LwM2M. The Client and Server should negotiate the instance(s) used to exchange the data. For example:
 - Using a single instance for both directions communication, from Client to Server and from Server to Client.
 - Using an instance for communication from Client to Server and another one for communication from Server to Client
 - Using several instances
 LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.title: Data
0.description: Indicates the application data content.

1.title: Data Priority
1.description:
Indicates the Application data priority:
0:Immediate
1:BestEffort
2:Latest
3-100: Reserved for future use.
101-254: Proprietary mode.

2.title: Data Creation Time
2.description: Indicates the Data instance creation timestamp. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

3.title: Data Description
3.description:
Indicates the data description.
e.g. "meter reading".

4.title: Data Format
4.description:
Indicates the format of the Application Data.
e.g. YG-Meter-Water-Reading
UTF8-string

5.title: App ID
5.description: Indicates the destination Application ID.

500.title: CoAP Config
500.description:
This object is used to configure the CoAP transmission parameters (RFC7252) and other parameters that affect CoAP transmission.
         LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: CoAP Config
items.description:
This object is used to configure the CoAP transmission parameters (RFC7252) and other parameters that affect CoAP transmission.
         LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.title: Network Bearer
0.description: Identify the network bearer for which these parameters are applicable. The value is from the network bearer list defined in the Connectivity Monitoring Object (ID: 4). Please, verify the list of currently reserved values.

1.title: ACK_TIMEOUT
1.description: The initial value of retransmission timeout in CoAP. Default is set to that of RFC7252, that is 2 seconds. Units: s.

2.title: ACK_RANDOM_FACTOR
2.description: The initial value of retransmission timeout in CoAP. Default is set to that of RFC7252, that is a value of 1.5.

3.title: MAX_RETRANSMIT
3.description: The maximum number of retransmissions. Default is set to that of RFC7252, that is 4 retransmissions.

4.title: NSTART
4.description: Number of simultaneous outstanding interactions that the LwM2M client can accept from a given LwM2M Server. An outstanding interaction is either a CON for which an ACK has not yet been received but is still expected (message layer) or a request for which neither a response nor an Acknowledgment message has yet been received but is still expected. Default is set to that of RFC7252, that is 1 interaction.

5.title: DEFAULT_LEISURE
5.description: If a server does decide to respond to a multicast request, it should not respond immediately. Instead, it should pick based on RFC7252, Section 8.2. If the LwM2M Client does not have data to compute the Leisure time it should use that of Default Leisure as specified in RFC7252. Units: s.

6.title: PROBING_RATE
6.description: This resource represents the maximum probing rate accepted by this LwM2M Client in bytes per second. Units: B/s.

7.title: DTLS Retransmission Timer
7.description: The LwM2M Server may modify the initial DTLS retransmission timer value of 1 second into a different value. This will have effects on latency as well as on congestion, thus the timer value should be handled carefully. Units: s.

8.title: Max Response Waiting Time
8.description: The maximum time in seconds the device will wait for a separate response to a request.

501.title: LTE-MTC Band Config
501.description:
This object is used to configure the cellular band used by the device as well as to change the band. It is intended to be used on LTE bands, as in NB-IoT and LTE Cat M1 frequency bands.
         LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: LTE-MTC Band Config
items.description:
This object is used to configure the cellular band used by the device as well as to change the band. It is intended to be used on LTE bands, as in NB-IoT and LTE Cat M1 frequency bands.
         LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

1.title: EARFCN
1.description: E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number (EARFCN), the carrier frequency of the device radio.

2.title: Current Frequency (Downlink)
2.description: The current frequency used in the current band in MHz (Downlink). Units: MHz.

3.title: Current Frequency (Uplink)
3.description: The current frequency used in the current band in MHz (Uplink). Units: MHz.

4.title: Prioritized Channels
4.description: Indicates a list of currently supported EARFCNs in priority order. Each Resource Instance has a value from the band list.

5.title: Reset Timeout
5.description: Time that the device will wait until reset once the Reset Resource is triggered. Units: s.

48.title: Vendor specific extensions
48.description: This resource links to a vendor specific object.

5750.title: Application Type
5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string depending on the use case.

502.title: CO Detector
502.description: This is an alarm that should be raised if the sensor detects a higher than threshold CO level. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: CO Detector
items.description: This is an alarm that should be raised if the sensor detects a higher than threshold CO level. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.title: CO Sensor Location Tag
0.description: Verbose identification of the location of the CO sensor.

1.title: CO Detected
1.description: 0 = false (CO NOT detected), 1 = true (CO Detected)

2.title: Ambient CO Value
2.description: CO value (in ppm) received for the area. Units: ppm.

3.title: CO Value
3.description: Last or Current Measured CO Value (in ppm) from the Sensor. Units: ppm.

4.title: Min CO Range Value
4.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor (in ppm). Units: ppm.

5.title: Max CO Range Value
5.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor. Units: ppm.

6.title: CO Detection Accuracy
6.description: Indicate range of the accuracy for the temperature Sensor. Units: ppm.

7.title: Minimum Measured CO Value
7.description: The minimum CO value (in ppm) measured by the sensor since power ON or reset. Units: ppm.

8.title: Maximum Measured CO Value
8.description: The maximum CO value measured (in ppm) by the sensor since power ON or reset Units: ppm.

9.title: Upper CO Threshold
9.description: Indicate the Upper threshold for the CO Value (in ppm). Units: ppm.

5514.title: Latitude
5514.description: The decimal notation of latitude, e.g. -43.5723 (World Geodetic System 1984).

5515.title: Longitude
5515.description: The decimal notation of longitude, e.g. 153.21760 (World Geodetic System 1984).

6039.title: Altitude
6039.description: Altitude above sea level in meters. Units: m.

6048.title: Alarm loudness
6048.description: Indicate the loudness of the alarm. Units: dB.

503.title: Fire Alarm
503.description: This is an alarm that should be raised if the sensor(s) detect fire, based on the values reported from Temperature, Humidity, Smoke (CO2). LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Fire Alarm
items.description: This is an alarm that should be raised if the sensor(s) detect fire, based on the values reported from Temperature, Humidity, Smoke (CO2). LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.title: Temperature Sensor Location Tag
0.description: Verbose identification of the location of the Temperature sensor location

1.title: Temperature Unit
1.description: Temperature Units: 0 = Celsius, 1 = Fahrenheit, 2 = Kelvin. All temperature values are represented in this unit.

2.title: Ambient Temperature
2.description: Temperature for the area.

3.title: Temperature Value
3.description: Last or Current Measured Temperature Value from the Sensor. The value 65534 indicates that the Sensor data is not available.

4.title: Minimum Measured Temperature Value
4.description: The minimum Temperature value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset.

5.title: Maximum Measured Temperature Value
5.description: The maximum Temperature value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset.

6.title: Min Temperature Range Value
6.description: The minimum temperature value that can be measured by the sensor.

7.title: Max Temperature Range Value
7.description: The maximum temperature value that can be measured by the sensor.

8.title: Lower Temperature Accuracy
8.description: Indicates the lower end of the accuracy range for the temperature sensor.

9.title: Upper Temperature Accuracy
9.description: Indicates the upper end of the accuracy range for the temperature sensor.

10.title: Temperature Threshold
10.description: Indicates the maximum threshold for the temperature.

11.title: Temperature Sensor Error
11.description: Temperature Sensor Error: 0 = false (Working correctly), 1 = true (Faulty).

13.title: Temperature Alarm Loudness
13.description: Indicates the loudness of temperature alarm. Units: dB.

14.title: Humidity Sensor Location Tag
14.description: Verbose identification of the location of the Humidity sensor.

15.title: Ambient Relative Humidity
15.description: Relative humidity for the area. Units: %RH.

16.title: Humidity Value
16.description: Last or Current Measured Humidity Value from the Sensor. The value 0 indicates that the Sensor data is not available. Units: /100.

17.title: Minimum Measured Humidity Value
17.description: The minimum Humidity value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset. Units: /100.

18.title: Maximum Measured Humidity Value
18.description: The maximum Humidity value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset. Units: /100.

19.title: Humidity Accuracy
19.description: Indicate the accuracy for the Humidity Sensor. Units: /100.

20.title: Humidity Threshold
20.description: Indicate the threshold for the Humidity. Units: /100.

21.title: Humidity Sensor Error
21.description: Humidity Sensor Error: 0 = false (Working correctly), 1 = true (Faulty)

23.title: Humidity Alarm Loudness
23.description: Indicates the loudness of the Humidity alarm. Units: dB.

24.title: Smoke Sensor Location Tag
24.description: Verbose identification of the location of the Smoke sensor.

25.title: CO2 Alarm State
25.description: 0 = False (CO2 alarm threshold not exceeded), 1 = True (CO2 alarm threshold exceeded).

26.title: Ambient CO2 Value
26.description: CO2 value for the area. Units: ppm.

27.title: CO2 Value
27.description: Last or Current Measured CO2 Value from the sensor. The value 0 indicates that the Sensor data is not available. Units: ppm.

28.title: Minimum Measured CO2 Value
28.description: The minimum CO2 value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset. Units: ppm.

29.title: Maximum Measured CO2 Value
29.description: The maximum CO2 value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset. Units: ppm.

30.title: CO2 Threshold
30.description: Indicate the alarm threshold for the CO2. Units: ppm.

31.title: Smoke Sensor Error
31.description: Smoke Sensor Error: 0 = false (Working correctly), 1 = true (Faulty)

33.title: Smoke Alarm Loudness
33.description: Indicates the loudness of smoke alarm Units: dB.

5514.title: Latitude
5514.description: The decimal notation of latitude, e.g. -43.5723 (World Geodetic System 1984).

5515.title: Longitude
5515.description: The decimal notation of longitude, e.g. 153.21760 (World Geodetic System 1984).

6039.title: Altitude
6039.description: Altitude above sea level in meters. Units: m.

504.title: Remote SIM Provisioning
504.description: This is a device management object that should be used for Remote SIM Provisioning according to GSMA standards LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Remote SIM Provisioning
items.description: This is a device management object that should be used for Remote SIM Provisioning according to GSMA standards LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.title: Current SIM Type
0.description:
Provides the information about the currently being used SIM Type:
0: UICC (removable)
1: eUICC (removable)
2: eUICC (non-removable)
3: iUICC
4-24: Reserved for future use

1.title: Supported SIM Type
1.description:
Provides the information about the currently supported SIM Types: 
0: UICC (removable)
1: eUICC (removable)
2: eUICC (non-removable)
3: iUICC
4-24: Reserved for future use

2.title: Service Provider Name
2.description: Provides the name of the Service Provider assocatiated with the downloaded profile or the profile currently being downloaded.

3.title: Download URI/Information
3.description:
URI, or formatted data containing the URI (e.g. GSMA SGP.22 Activation Code), from where the device can download the profile package by an alternative mechanism. 
The URI format is defined in RFC 3986.

5.title: RSP Update State
5.description:
Indicates current state with respect to the executed RSP action(s) in the RSP update resource. This value is set by the LwM2M Client.
0: Idle (before downloading a profile or after successful completetion of the action(s))
1: Downloading (The data sequence is on the way)
2: Downloaded profile ready for installation
3: Installing
5: Enabling
6: Disabling
7: Deleting
8: Resetting memory
9: Pending end-user consent
10: Pending confirmation code
11-24: Reserved for future use

6.title: RSP Update Result
6.description:
Contains the result of the executed RSP action(s) in the RSP update resource.
0: Initial value. Once the updating process is initiated (Download /Update), this Resource MUST be reset to Initial value. 
1: RSP action completed successfully.
2: Not enough SIM memory for the new Profile package. 
3. Out of RAM during downloading process. 
4: Connection lost during downloading process.
5: Integrity check failure for new downloaded profile package. 
6: Unsupported profile package type. 
7: Invalid URI
8: Unsupported protocol.
9: Not authorized to download profile at the given URI.
10: Failed to authenticate server given by the URI.
11: Generic download and installation error.
12: Error in profile package format
13: Failed to enable profile.
14: Failed to disable profile.
15: Failed to delete profile.
16: Failed to reset memory.
17-24: Reserved for future use

7.title: Profile Name
7.description: Name of the downloaded profile / profile package or the profile / profile package currently being downloaded.

8.title: Profile Package Version
8.description: Version of the downloaded profile / profile package or the profile / profile package currently being downloaded.

9.title: Free Memory on SIM
9.description: Estimated current available amount of storage space on SIM which can store data and software in the LwM2M Device (expressed in kibibytes). Units: KiB.

10.title: Total Memory on SIM
10.description: Total amount of storage space which can store data and software in the LwM2M Device Units: KiB.

11.title: Integrated Circuit Card Identifier (ICCID)
11.description:
This resource provides the unique identification number for each installed profile of the current SIM in case of RSP support or
the unique identification number of the current SIM in case of current SIM being a UICC with no RSP support. Please refer ETSI TS 102.22.1. In case of multiple installed profiles,
the currently active profile is the first instance.

12.title: eUICC ID
12.description: eUICC-ID (a.k.a. EID), see GSMA SGP.02 and GSMA SGP.29 for definitions

13.title: RSP Type
13.description:
Provides the information about the Remote SIM Provisioning (RSP) type of the current SIM:
0: No RSP support
1: GSMA eSIM for M2M devices
2: GSMA eSIM for consumer devices
3-24: Reserved for future use

14.title: Selected ICCID for RSP operation
14.description:
Indicates ICCID of profile selected for profile specific RSP operations. This resource must be present if multiple installed profiles is supported
by the RSP implementation. In case of only support for a single profile at a time this resource is not required to be present for profile selection. After successful installation of
a profile the value of this resource (if present) is updated to the ICCID of the installed profile.

15.title: RSP Consent Reason
15.description: Provides information on the requested user consent

16.title: RSP User Consent
16.description:
User consent decision. The following values are possible:
0: Approved
1: Rejected
2-24: Reserved for future use

17.title: RSP Confirmation Code
17.description: Provides a confirmation code (see e.g. GSMA SGP.21/22)

18.title: RSP Data Type
18.description:
RSP data type for set and get RSP data:
0: SM-DP+ default address (see GSMA SGP.22)
1: eUICCInfo2 (see GSMA SGP.22)
2: DeviceInfo (see GSMA SGP.22)
3: eSIM Profile Metadata (GSMA SGP.22 ProfileInfo default data for all installed profiles)
5: ISD-P AID (see GSMA SGP.22) - for profile identified by resource 14
6: Profile state (see GSMA SGP.22) - for profile identified by resource 14
7: Profile Nickname (see GSMA SGP.22) - for profile identified by resource 14
8: Service provider name (see GSMA SGP.22) - for profile identified by resource 14
9: Profile name (see GSMA SGP.22) - for profile identified by resource 14
10: Icon type (see GSMA SGP.22) - for profile identified by resource 14
11: Icon (see GSMA SGP.22) - for profile identified by resource 14
12: Profile Class (see GSMA SGP.22) - for profile identified by resource 14
13: Notification Configuration Info (see GSMA SGP.22) - for profile identified by resource 14
14: Profile Owner (see GSMA SGP.22) - for profile identified by resource 14
15: SM-DP+ proprietary data (see GSMA SGP.22) - for profile identified by resource 14
16: Profile Policy Rules (see GSMA SGP.22) - for profile identified by resource 14
17: RSP formatted data request/response (RSP type specific)
18-24: Reserved for future use

19.title: Set RSP Data
19.description:
This resource is used to update the (e/i)UICC data / profile specific data of type according to resource 30.
It is up to the RSP type whether update of the data is possible or not.

20.title: Get RSP Data
20.description:
This resource is used to retrieve the (e/i)UICC data / profile specific data of type according to resource 30.
It is up to the RSP type whether retrieval of the data is possible or not.

505.title: LwM2M SIM Provisioning
505.description: This is a device management object that should be used for Remote SIM Provisioning from a LwM2M server. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: LwM2M SIM Provisioning
items.description: This is a device management object that should be used for Remote SIM Provisioning from a LwM2M server. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.title: Current SIM Type
0.description:
Provides the information about the currently being used SIM Type:
0: UICC (removable)
1: eUICC (removable)
2: eUICC (non-removable)
3: iUICC

1.title: Supported SIM Type
1.description:
Provides the information about the currently supported SIM Types: 
0: UICC (removable)
1: eUICC (removable)
2: eUICC (non-removable)
3: iUICC

2.title: Service Provider Name
2.description: Provides the Service Provider Name using which LwM2M is currently communicating to the Server.

3.title: Profile Package
3.description: Profile Package is a personalised Profile using an interoperable description format that is transmitted to an eUICC to load and install a Profile.

4.title: Profile URI
4.description: URI from where the device can download the profile package by an alternative mechanism. As soon the device has received the Profile package URI it performs the download at the next practical opportunity. The URI format is defined in RFC 3986. For example, coaps://example.org/profile is a syntactically valid URI. The URI scheme determines the protocol to be used. For CoAP this endpoint MAY be a LwM2M Server but does not necessarily need to be. A CoAP server implementing block-wise transfer is sufficient as a server hosting a firmware repository and the expectation is that this server merely serves as a separate file server making profile images available to LwM2M Clients. This server can be the future carrier server as well from which IoT devices would like to use the service.

6.title: Update State
6.description:
Indicates current state with respect to this profile update. This value is set by the LwM2M Client. 
0: Idle (before downloading or after successful updating) 
1: Downloading (The data sequence is on the way) 
2: Downloaded 
3: Updating If writing the profile package to Package Resource is done, or, if the device has downloaded the profile package from the Package URI the state changes to Downloaded. Writing an empty string to Package URI Resource or setting the Package Resource to NULL (Ã¢â‚¬Ëœ\0Ã¢â‚¬â„¢), resets the Profile Update State Machine: the State Resource value is set to Idle and the Update Result Resource value is set to 0. When in Downloaded state, and the executable Resource Update is triggered, the state changes to Updating. If the Update Resource failed, the state returns at Downloaded. If performing the Update Resource was successful, the state changes from Updating to Idle.

7.title: Update Result
7.description:
Contains the result of downloading or updating the Profile 
0: Initial value. Once the updating process is initiated (Download /Update), this Resource MUST be reset to Initial value. 
1: Profile updated successfully, 
2: Not enough SIM memory for the new Profile package. 
3. Out of RAM during downloading process. 
4: Connection lost during downloading process. 5: Integrity check failure for new downloaded package. 
6: Unsupported package type. 
7: Invalid URI
8: Unsupported protocol. 

A LwM2M client indicates the failure to retrieve the Profile using the URI provided in the Package URI resource by writing the value 9 to the /x/0/7 (Update Result resource) when the URI contained a URI scheme unsupported by the client. Consequently, the LwM2M Client is unable to retrieve the Profile using the URI provided by the LwM2M Server in the Package URI when it refers to an unsupported protocol.

8.title: Profile Name
8.description: Name of the Profile Package.

9.title: Profile Package Version
9.description: Version of the Profile package.

10.title: Profile Update Protocol Support
10.description:
This resource indicates what protocols the LwM2M Client implements to retrieve Profiles. The LwM2M server uses this information to decide what URI to include in the Package URI. A LwM2M Server MUST NOT include a URI in the Package URI object that uses a protocol that is unsupported by the LwM2M client. For example, if a LwM2M client indicates that it supports CoAP and CoAPS then a LwM2M Server must not provide an HTTP URI in the Packet URI. The following values are defined by this version of the specification: 
0: CoAP (as defined in RFC 7252) with the additional support for block-wise transfer. CoAP is the default setting. 
1: CoAPS (as defined in RFC 7252) with the additional support for block-wise transfer 
2: HTTP 1.1 (as defined in RFC 7230) 
3: HTTPS 1.1 (as defined in RFC 7230) Additional values MAY be defined in the future. Any value not understood by the LwM2M Server MUST be ignored.

11.title: Profile Update Delivery Method
11.description:
The LwM2M Client uses this resource to
indicate its support for transferring Profile
images to the client either via the Package
Resource (=push) or via the Package URI
Resource (=pull) mechanism.
0: Pull only
1: Push only
2: Both. In this case the LwM2M Server
MAY choose the preferred mechanism for
conveying the profile image to the
LwM2M Client.

12.title: Free Memory on SIM
12.description: Estimated current available amount of storage space on SIM which can store data and software in the LwM2M Device (expressed in kibibytes). Units: KiB.

13.title: Total Memory on SIM
13.description: Total amount of storage space which can store data and software in the LwM2M Device. Units: KiB.

14.title: Integrated Circuit Card Identifier (ICCID)
14.description: This Elementary File (EF) provides a unique identification number for the UICC/Smart Cards. Please refer ETSI TS 102.22.1.

15.title: eUICC ID
15.description: eUICC-ID (a.k.a. EID), see GSMA SGP.02 and GSMA SGP.29 for definitions.

16.title: Profile Type
16.description: Free optional text produced by the SM-DP+ server. This is equivalent to the "Profile Description ID" as described in Annex B of SGP.21.

3339.title: Audio Clip
3339.description: This IPSO object should be used for a speaker that plays a pre-recorded audio clip or an audio output that is sent elsewhere. For example, an elevator which announces the floor of the building. A resource is provided to store the clip, a dimmer resource controls the relative sound level of the playback, and a duration resource limits the maximum playback time. After the duration time is reached, any remaining samples in the clip are ignored, and the clip player will be ready to play another clip. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.description: This IPSO object should be used for a speaker that plays a pre-recorded audio clip or an audio output that is sent elsewhere. For example, an elevator which announces the floor of the building. A resource is provided to store the clip, a dimmer resource controls the relative sound level of the playback, and a duration resource limits the maximum playback time. After the duration time is reached, any remaining samples in the clip are ignored, and the clip player will be ready to play another clip. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

5522.title: Clip

3340.title: Timer
3340.description:
This IPSO object is used to time events and actions, using patterns common to industrial timers. A write to the trigger resource or On/Off input state change starts the timing operation, and the timer remaining time shows zero when the operation is complete. The patterns supported are One-Shot (mode 1), On-Time or Interval (mode 2), Time delay on pick-up or TDPU (mode 3), and Time Delay on Drop-Out or TDDO (mode 4). Mode 0 disables the timer, so the output follows the input with no delay. A counter is provided to count occurrences of the timer output changing from 0 to 1. Writing a value of zero resets the counter. The Digital Input State resource reports the state of the timer output.
         LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Timer
items.description:
This IPSO object is used to time events and actions, using patterns common to industrial timers. A write to the trigger resource or On/Off input state change starts the timing operation, and the timer remaining time shows zero when the operation is complete. The patterns supported are One-Shot (mode 1), On-Time or Interval (mode 2), Time delay on pick-up or TDPU (mode 3), and Time Delay on Drop-Out or TDDO (mode 4). Mode 0 disables the timer, so the output follows the input with no delay. A counter is provided to count occurrences of the timer output changing from 0 to 1. Writing a value of zero resets the counter. The Digital Input State resource reports the state of the timer output.
         LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

5501.title: Digital Input Counter

5521.title: Delay Duration

5525.title: Minimum Off-time
5525.description: The duration of the rearm delay (i.e. the delay from the end of one cycle until the beginning of the next, the inhibit time). Units: s.

5526.title: Timer Mode
5526.description: Type of timer pattern used by the timer. 1: One-shot, 2: On-Time or Interval, 3: Time delay on pick-up, 4: Time Delay on Drop-Out, 0: disables the timer.

5534.title: Counter
5534.description: Counts the number of times the timer output transitions from 0 to 1.

5538.title: Remaining Time
5538.description: The time remaining in an operation. Units: s.

5543.title: Digital State
5543.description: The current state of the timer output.

5544.title: Cumulative Time
5544.description: The total time in seconds that the timer input is true. Writing a 0 resets the time. Units: s.

5750.title: Application Type

5850.title: On/Off

3341.title: Addressable Text Display
3341.description:
This IPSO object is used to send text to a text-only or text mode graphics display. Writing a string of text to the text resource causes it to be displayed at the selected X and Y locations on the display. If X or Y are set to a value greater than the size of the display, the position "wraps around" to the modulus of the setting and the display size. Likewise, if the text string overflows the display size, the text "wraps around" and displays on the next line down or, if the last line has been written, wraps around to the top of the display. Brightness and Contrast controls are provided to allow control of various display types including STN and DSTN type LCD character displays. Writing an empty payload to the Clear Display resource causes the display to be erased.
         LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Addressable Text Display
items.description:
This IPSO object is used to send text to a text-only or text mode graphics display. Writing a string of text to the text resource causes it to be displayed at the selected X and Y locations on the display. If X or Y are set to a value greater than the size of the display, the position "wraps around" to the modulus of the setting and the display size. Likewise, if the text string overflows the display size, the text "wraps around" and displays on the next line down or, if the last line has been written, wraps around to the top of the display. Brightness and Contrast controls are provided to allow control of various display types including STN and DSTN type LCD character displays. Writing an empty payload to the Clear Display resource causes the display to be erased.
         LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

3357.title: rrcStateChangeEvent
3357.description: Current RRC state change information, including the event that triggered the state change LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: false Mandatory: false

0.title: rrcState
0.description:
RRC state
       0 =  null
        1 = idleCampedOnAnyCell
        2 = idleCampedNormally
       3 =  idlConnecting
        4 = connectedNormally
        5 = releasing(when going from connected to idle)

1.title: rrcStateChangeCause
1.description:
Trigger for RRC state change
 0 = toNull (Generic cause for all state transitions to null state. From any stable state other than null to null state)
1 = IdleFromUpperLayer (Camped due to connection aborted from upper layers. From any stable state to idlecampednormally)
2 = idleT300Expiry (Camped due to T300expiry. From any stable state other than connectednormally to idlecampednormally)
3= idleConnectionReject (Camped due to connection rejected from eNB. From any stable state other than connectednormally to idlecampednormally)
4 = idleCellReselectionFailure (Camped due to cell reselection. From idlecampednormally to idlecampednormally)
5 = idleBarred (Camped due to access barring. From any stable state to idlecampednormally)
6 = idleOtherRrcFailue (Camped due to other reasons. From any stable state to idlecampednormally)
7 = idleEnteringLte (From null to idlecampednormally)
8 = connectingEmergencyCall (Enter connecting due to emergency call. Any stable state other than connectednormally to connectednormally)
9 = connectingHighPriAccess (Enter connecting due to high priority access. From idlecampednormally to connectednormally)
10 = connectingReceiveCall (Enter connecting due to receiving call. From idlecampednormally to connectednormally)
11 = connectingMakingCall (Enter connecting due to making call. From idlecampednormally to connectednormally)
12 = connectingMoData (Enter connecting due to originating a data session. From idlecampednormally to connectednormally)
13 = connectedHoFailure (Camped on a cell in connected state due to handover failure. From connectednormally to idlecampednormally or idlecampedonanycell)
14 = connectedOther (Camped on a cell in connected state due to other reasons. From connectednormally to idlecampednormally or idlecampedonanycell.
15 = releasingT311Expriry (Enter releasing due to T311 expiry. From connected normally to idlecampednormally)
16 = releasingT301Expriry (Enter releasing due to T301 expiry. From connected normally to idlecampednormally)
17 = releasingReject (Enter releasing due to RRC connection reestablishment reject. From connected normally to idlecampednormally)
18 = connectingOther (From idlecampednormally to connectednormally for other procedures like Extended service request, TAU, or RRC reestablishment

3412.title: LPWAN Communication
3412.description: The uCIFI communication object provides attributes related to the communication on the LPWAN network, including multicast grouping. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: LPWAN Communication
items.description: The uCIFI communication object provides attributes related to the communication on the LPWAN network, including multicast grouping. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

1.title: Type of network
1.description: Type of LPWAN communication network (e.g. LoRaWAN, NB-IoT, wireless mesh, power line).

2.title: IPv4 address
2.description: Deviceâ€™s IPv4 address.

3.title: IPv6 address
3.description: Deviceâ€™s IPv6 address.

4.title: Network address
4.description: Address of the device on the LPWAN network.

5.title: Secondary network address
5.description: Secondary address used to communicate with the device on the LPWAN network.

6.title: MAC address
6.description: IEEE MAC address of the device.

7.title: Peer address
7.description: Address of a peer (e.g. a router, a mesh node, a gateway).

8.title: Multicast group address
8.description: Group address from which the  device should accept incoming messages and/or commands.

9.title: Multicast group key
9.description: Security key (e.g. AES128) to be shared with other members to be part of a multicast group.

10.title: Data rate
10.description: Data rate of the communication used on the LPWAN network. Units: B/s.

11.title: Transmit power
11.description: Transmit power (also called TxPower) used by the device on the LPWAN network in decibel per milliwatt. Units: dBm.

12.title: Frequency
12.description: Frequency of the wireless communication used on the LPWAN network. Units: Hz.

13.title: Session time
13.description: Starting time of the multicast session. The device shall not accept incoming messages before this time or after this time + session duration. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

14.title: Session duration
14.description: Duration of the multicast session. The device shall accept incoming messages only during this session duration time, starting at "Session time". Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone. Units: s.

15.title: Mesh node
15.description: Set to True if the device is a mesh node that should repeat incoming messages on a mesh network.

16.title: Maximum repeat time
16.description: Maximum number of times a message should be repeated within a mesh network.

17.title: Number of repeats
17.description: Number of mesh nodes between the device and the destination device (e.g. another device or a router) including the destination node, on a mesh network.

18.title: Signal to noise ratio
18.description: Ratio of signal power to the noise power. Units: dB.

19.title: Communication failure
19.description: Set to True when the device can't communicate properly.

20.title: Received Signal Strength Indication
20.description: Signal strength of the communication network measured by the device (a.k.a. RSSI or signal level). Units: dBm.

23.title: Current Communication Operator
23.description: Deviceâ€™s current communication operator. Communication operators could be private operators. Thus this resource is free text format and does not use Mobile Network Code or equivalent.

24.title: Integrated Circuit Card Identifier
24.description: Unique identifier used to identify a communication SIM card. The ICCID is defined by the ITU-T recommendation E.118 as the Primary Account Number, composed of 19 or 20 characters containing the ISO Industry Identifier, country code, issuer identity, account ID, and other data which allows the network operator to identify the card.

3417.title: Luminaire asset
3417.description: The uCIFI luminaire asset is an object that enables outdoor lighting control software to configure outdoor lamp controllers. It also enables outdoor lamp controllers to send Zhaga D4i or DALI attributes read from the control gears, to centrally managed outdoor lighting control software or asset management systems. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false
