5500.title: Digital Input State
5500.description: The current state of a digital input.

5903.title: Busy to Clear delay
5903.description: Delay from the detection state to the clear state in ms. Units: ms.

5904.title: Clear to Busy delay
5904.description: Delay from the clear state to the busy state in ms. Units: ms.

3395@1.1.title: oA Logical Push-Button Sensor
3395@1.1.description: The 'oA Logical Push-Button Sensor' represents the logical part of a standard, normally open, push-button input. The corresponding physical device is a button with a spring that returns the button to the un-pushed state once it is released.\nThe Object supports several events such as 'click', 'hold', 'double-click' and 'release'. It also indicates if the button is 'stuck'. For physical devices with multiple push-button inputs, an instance of this Object is required to map each input. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: oA Logical Push-Button Sensor
items.description: The 'oA Logical Push-Button Sensor' represents the logical part of a standard, normally open, push-button input. The corresponding physical device is a button with a spring that returns the button to the un-pushed state once it is released.\nThe Object supports several events such as 'click', 'hold', 'double-click' and 'release'. It also indicates if the button is 'stuck'. For physical devices with multiple push-button inputs, an instance of this Object is required to map each input. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

202.title: Push-Button Event Value
202.description:
This Resource represents the last generated Event by the push-button:
* 0: RELEASE - push-button was released
* 1: CLICK - single click detected
* 2: HOLD - long press/hold detected
* 3: DOUBLE-CLICK - two sequential clicks detected
* 255: STUCK - button was detected as stuck.
			
*Note* The Push-Button Event allows to filter part of the behaviour of the press/release actions from a user. Instead of reporting all press/release operations, this resource only reports a new value when a specific operation occurs.

203.title: Single Click Time
203.description: Defines the maximum period of time the push-button can be pressed, in order to be recognized as 'click'. If the button is pressed longer than this time period, it is recognized as 'hold' press. See Resource description of Push-Button Event for details.\n*Note* the maximum limit for this value is 60s, as any press longer than that is considered 'stuck button'. Units: ms.

204.title: Hold Repeat Time
204.description: Defines the period of time between repetitions of push-button event reporting messages with 'hold' value. After the 'hold' event is triggered and the first message is sent, the 'hold' message is repeated every time the 'Hold Repeat Time' is past, and until a 'release' or 'button stuck' state is reached.This value should always be higher than 'Single Click Time' and small intervals may significantly affect network performance.\n*Note* the maximum limit for this value is 60s, as any press longer than that is considered 'stuck button'. Units: ms.

3396@1.1.title: oA Physical Colour Light-Point Actuator
3396@1.1.description: The 'oA_Physical_Colour_Light-Point_Actuator' represents a physical colour light-point actuator. It is necessary to map at least on Logical Light Point Actuator to control the intensity and one Logical Colour Light-Point to control the colour to the Physical Colour Light-Point. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: oA Physical Colour Light-Point Actuator
items.description: The 'oA_Physical_Colour_Light-Point_Actuator' represents a physical colour light-point actuator. It is necessary to map at least on Logical Light Point Actuator to control the intensity and one Logical Colour Light-Point to control the colour to the Physical Colour Light-Point. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

100.title: Current Intensity
100.description: This Resource represents the current intensity (0-1). This is a 'real-time' value, which is given independently of any ongoing dimming request.

102.title: Remaining Transition Time
102.description: Remaining approximated time of any ongoing 'Set Intensity', 'Step' or 'Switch' process which requires a variation of the light output over a period of time higher or equal to one 100ms interval. When the process is started, the value is equal to the time value selected for the process and it is continuously decreased until completed (time=0), or a 'Stop Dimming' request is received.\n\t\t\t\t\n**NOTE:** If during a request the process reaches the Maximum/Minimum Intensity limits, the time is automatically set to '0' as the process is stopped. Scaling is 100ms per unit Units: ms.

103.title: Physical Minimum Intensity
103.description: Minimum intensity that can be set for this instance of a Light Point. This value is factory defined by luminaire or gear manufacturer.

104.title: Minimum Intensity
104.description:
The value set in this Resource limits the minimum output of the Light Point. when performing any transition operation (e.g. Switch(ON),'Dim(DOWN)','Step(DOWN)' or Set_Intensity(x)') the minimum intensity value indicated by this Resource will override any other definition or request input parameter value.
Changing this Resource stops any transition process, and the 'Remaining Transition Time' and 'Current Intensity' are updated.
			
**Note:** This value must be greater or equal to 'Physical Minimum Intensity' and smaller or equal to 'Maximum Intensity'. If a Light Point with fixed output is used, the 'Minimum Intensity' and 'Maximum Intensity' MUST be defined with the same value.

105.title: Maximum Intensity
105.description:
The value set in this Resource limits the maximum output of the Light Point. when performing any transition operation (e.g. Switch(ON),'Dim(UP)','Step(UP)' or Set_Intensity(x)') the maximum intensity value indicated by this Resource will override any other definition or request input parameter value.
Changing this Resource stops any transition process, and the 'Remaining Transition Time' and 'Current Intensity' are updated.
			
**Note:** This value must be greater or equal to 'Minimum Intensity'. If a Light Point with fixed output is used, the 'Minimum Intensity' and 'Maximum Intensity' MUST be defined with the same value.

110.title: Power On Behaviour
110.description:
Defines the default behaviour of the light point when it is switched 'On'. The following options are possible:
- *CONFIGURED_ON* intensity goes to the stored default value ('Power On Intensity') [default option]
- *FULL_ON* intensity always goes to the maximum intensity value allowed
- *RECALL* if available, the intensity is recalled from 'Stored Intensity', otherwise 'Power On Intensity' is used

111.title: Power On Intensity
111.description: Defines the default Intensity used in switch operations that result in a 'On' state. It is used if no intensity is given in the switch request payload and if 'Power On Behaviour' is CONFIGURED_ON. When this Resource is not defined, the value to be used should be '1'.\n\t\t\t\t\n**Note:** When setting this value, the Minimum/Maximum intensity limits must be validated. A write request that requires the final value to be adjusted should send a reply message with the corrected value.

114.title: Stored Intensity
114.description: This Resource represents a copy of the last 'Current Intensity' that is bigger than 0, before a power cycle is triggered. It should be updated in NVM whenever a transition process is completed, and optionally if a power cycle is triggered.

115.title: System Failure Intensity
115.description:
This is the intensity value the light point goes to if the connection to the network is lost for longer than 'System Failure Time'.
				
**Note:** When setting the value of this Resource, the limits of 'Minimum Intensity' and 'Maximum Intensity' must be validated. A write operation that requires the final value to be adjusted should result in a reply message with the final corrected value.
Independently of the previous limits, a '0' value is allowed and it means, in case of network failure, the 'On/Off Status' is set to 'Off'.

122.title: Current Colour Y
122.description: This Resource represents the x value of the current colour. This is a 'real-time' value, which is given independently of any ongoing change request. Scaling is 0.0001 per unit Units: K.

123.title: Current Colour X
123.description: This Resource represents the y value of the current colour. This is a 'real-time' value, which is given independently of any ongoing change request. Scaling is 0.0001 per unit Units: K.

124.title: Remaining Colour Transition Time
124.description: Remaining approximated time of any ongoing colour change process which requires a variation of the light output over a period of time higher or equal to one 100ms interval. When the process is started, the value is equal to the time value selected for the process and it is continuously decreased until completed (time=0), or a 'Stop' request is received.\n\t\t\t\t\n**NOTE:** If during a request the process reaches the colour limits, the time is automatically set to '0' as the process is stopped. Scaling is 100ms per unit Units: ms.

901.title: Documentary Description
901.description: Resource to hold a documentary text description of the object.

907.title: Error Status
907.description: Error status is a bit coded value that shows all current errors on the object. The error status changes as soon as a new error occurs or an old one is resolved. Bitwise: 0 (LSB): Hardware_Error, 1: Execution_Limit_LED_Temp, 2: Execution_Limit_Power_Restrictions, 3: Light-Point_Malfunction

908.title: Mounting Location
908.description: Describes the location of the device within the building. The content of the string is site specific. Units: B.

910.title: Total Energy Usage
910.description: The total energy usage of the device (accumulated value) Units: Ws.

911.title: Actual Power Usage
911.description: The actual power usage of the device. Scaling is 0.1W per unit Units: W.

912.title: Accuracy Class
912.description: The accuracy class of the energy sensor on the device (using either % accuracy or a letter that defines the accuracy class)

930.title: Operating Hours
930.description: The total operating hours where the light point is on. Units: h.

931.title: Adjusted Operating Hours
931.description: The total operating hours adjusted by the dim level of the luminaire.

5850.title: On/Off
5850.description: On/off control. Boolean value where True is On and False is Off.

201.title: Push-Button Status Value
201.description:
This Resource represents the current PRESSED/RELEASED state of the push-button.
* 0: RELEASED - the switch/push-button is pressed or contact is opened
* 1: PRESSED - the switch/push-button is pressed or contact is closed
* 2: FAULT - the contact is in a faulty condition (e.g. stuck or non-reactive)

3402@1.1.title: oA Receiving Object
3402@1.1.description: The 'oA Receiving Object' provides a resource for sensors/actuators to report their status message to. It is used with control objects as logical object that forwards the sensor and status data to the executing object.\nIt is also used to receive the 'go bootstrap' message, using the Struct-ID 255, in OOTB mode. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

901.title: Documentary Description

909.title: Executing Object

923.title: Status Report
923.description: The actuators and sensors report their status to this resource. It is also used to receive the 'go bootstrap' message, using the Struct-ID 255, in OOTB mode.

3403@1.1.title: oA Reporting Object
3403@1.1.description: The 'oA Reporting Object' packs several status messages available at the node into a single, size optimized message, as e.g. used with data collect or BMS interfacing. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: oA Reporting Object
items.description: The 'oA Reporting Object' packs several status messages available at the node into a single, size optimized message, as e.g. used with data collect or BMS interfacing. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

901.title: Documentary Description
901.description: Resource to hold a documentary text description of the object.

903.title: Application Group ID
903.description: The application group ID that the logical object is part of. This ID will define the application group the status reports are sent to. It is internally used as a pointer to the Group Object instance that hosts all the Group configurations. Units: s.

904.title: Status Resend Time
904.description:
The time specified as status resend time is used to resend the actual status to the application group the object is a member of, even if nothing changed.
The status resend time is restarted after every event. The actual interval is a random time with the maximum duration given by this resource. Randomization helps to avoid massive ongoing message collisions after system power up.
For example: Status resend time is set to 10 seconds;
* 00:00 status is sent
* 00:05 status changes and is sent immediatly
* 00:15 (or before, depending on the randomization) status is sent even though it did not change Units: s.

919.title: Status Report Structure ID
919.description: The ID of the status resource structure that is used to code the cyclic status report. See object 4012 'oA Status Report Structure' for more information Units: s.

items.description: RFC 6690 link, see https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6690.html

932.title: Reporting Object Instances
932.description: List of links to the reporting Object Instances in CoRE Link Format [RFC6690](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6690)

933.description: Link to the target resource in CoRE Link Format [RFC6690](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6690)\nNote taht the default for this entry is always the receiving object /4009/#/923. When Group communication is applied, the /#/ is determined by the group handling mechanisms and can be omitted.
933.title: Target Resource

3404@1.1.title: oA Scene
3404@1.1.description: The 'oA Scene' represents a scene model. The scene holds defined values for each actuator in one group. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: oA Scene
items.description: The 'oA Scene' represents a scene model. The scene holds defined values for each actuator in one group. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

650.title: Scene ID
650.description: The ID that is used to recall the scene. This needs to be unique within one application group.

651.title: Application Group ID
651.description: The application group ID the scene definition applies to.

652.title: Transition Time
652.description: Defines the transition time to be used for changing to this scene. Units: ms.

653.title: Scene Configuration
653.description: Defines the list of output properties that are changed when a scene is recalled. Complex Data comprising a Corelnk pointing to the resource, a payload that sets the resource and a boolean that says if POST or PUT should be applied

655.title: Changeable by User API
655.description: If true, the settings for this scene can be changed using the User API.

901.title: Documentary Description
901.description: Resource to hold a documentary text description of the object.

3405@1.1.title: oA OGC-Security
3405@1.1.description: The 'OGC Security' provides the appropriate keying material for a specific OGC Application group in the context of OGC. The keying material will be provided by a key distribution server, and must not be readable by any instance outside the local node. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

The keying material will be provided by a key distribution server, and must not be readable by any instance outside the local node. 0.title: OGC Security ID
0.description: Uniquely identifies the OpenAIS Security group that this instance is using.

3.title: Accepted Senders
3.description: Stores the identities (OSCORE / IPv6) and Keys of accepted senders in the group

5.title: Secret Group Key
5.description: Stores the shared symmetric key for low latency group communication.This Resource MUST NOT be readable by any server.

901.title: Documentary Description
901.description: Resource to hold a documentary text description of the object.

3406@1.1.title: oA Status Report Structure
3406@1.1.description: The 'oA Status_Report_Structure' describes the content of the status reports. Its ID is always the first byte, the following bytes are defined by Keys. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: oA Status Report Structure
items.description: The 'oA Status_Report_Structure' describes the content of the status reports. Its ID is always the first byte, the following bytes are defined by Keys. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

850.title: Status Report Structure ID
850.description: The ID of the status report structure. It is always the first byte of the transmitted status report.\nThis needs to be unique per receiving object. ID 255 is used to receive the 'go bootstrap' message.

851.title: Keys
851.description:
Defines the list of keys that are part of the status report. Most keys are present in the form 'object ID/resource ID'.
There is a simplified form that is used with status reports for objects. This reporting has implicit instance identification (it's the instance that creates reports, so no explicit instance identification is needed). This is using straight forward a list of resource contents that are determined by the list elements in their order.
				
Example of a simple form:
- The key list for reporting ID 1 is: 4001/101; 4021/5850; 4021/100; 4021/102;
- The values are: 4001/101:0.5; 4021/5850:false; 4021/100:0.3; 4021/102:7
- The coded stream will be: 1; 0.5; false; 0.3; 7 with the first byte 1 the reporting ID.
				
The explicit form, that is used with device status reports, needs to explicitly name the instances the reported values are from. To allow for that two special keys are used:
- *NoOfInstances:* This key is to allow several object instances to report their status in the same report, e.g. a Device reports the status of all its light point objects.
The block of keys following NoOfInstances, always starting with InstanceID, until the next NoOfInstances key is present in the status message for every instance, e.g. NoOfInstances=2 means the following block of keys is present twice.
- *InstanceID:* This key initiates the report of an object, is the first key before all the resource values. It defines the object instance that reports its status.
				
Example of an explicit form:
- The key list for reporting ID 2 is: NoOfInstances; InstanceId; 4001/101; NoOfInstances; InstanceId; 4021/100
- The coded stream will be 2;2;0;0.5;1;0.7;1;0;0.5 with the first byte 2 the ID of the structure definition, the second byte the number of instances (2), the third the instance ID of the first (0) instance, the reported value, the instance ID of the second (1) instance, the reported value, the number of instances (1) for the next object, the ID of the instance (0) and the value.

901.title: Documentary Description
901.description: Resource to hold a documentary text description of the object.

3407@1.1.title: Smoke Alarm
3407@1.1.description: This is an alarm that should be raised if the meter detects CO2 concentration above a pre-configured threshold. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Smoke Alarm
items.description: This is an alarm that should be raised if the meter detects CO2 concentration above a pre-configured threshold. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

6045.title: RSSI
6045.description: Received Signal Strength Indicator. Units: dBW.

6047.title: Detected CO2 percentage
6047.description: Current level of detected CO2 as a percentage of concentration. Units: /100.

6048.title: Alarm loudness
6048.description: Indicate the loudness of the alarm. Units: dB.

3408@1.1.title: Manhole Cover
3408@1.1.description: Describe the status of a manhole cover. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Manhole Cover
items.description: Describe the status of a manhole cover. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

1.title: Safety Angle Threshold
1.description: The threshold of manhole cover's safety angle. Units: rad.

2.title: Manhole Cover Tilt
2.description: The tilt angle of a manhole cover. Units: rad.

3.title: Cover Open Status
3.description: Indicate whether an open status of the manhole cover is detected. Not detected open [true] or Detected open [false].

3410:2.0.title: Device Extension
3410:2.0.description: The uCIFI device extension is an extension to the standard Lightweight M2M device (object ID 3) using the resource called "ExtDevInfo" (resource ID 22). LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: false Mandatory: false

1.title: GTIN model number
1.description: Standard global trade-in international number for the control device.

2.title: Manufacturer identifier
2.description: Unique identifier of the manufacturer of the control device, equivalent to IEEE's OUI (Organizational Unique Identifier). This value should be a Hexadecimal value. This value may be used by an online uCIFI product catalog server, for software modules to retrieve the data model of a device using this attribute associated with the model number on the "Device" (Id=3) object.

3.title: User-given name
3.description: User-readable name of the device set by the user.

4.title: Asset identifier
4.description: Identifier of the asset (e.g. meter, luminaire, container) that is controlled by the device.

5.title: Installation date
5.description: Installation date of the device. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

6.title: Software update
6.description: Set to True while software within the device is being updated.

7.title: Maintenance
7.description: Set to True when the device is in maintenance mode.

9.title: Device operating hours
9.description: Cumulated number of hours during which the device has been powered on. Units: h.

10.title: Additional firmware information
10.description: Additional information about peripheral firmware versions. The format is left to the vendor.

11.title: DST Start
11.description: The precise date and UTC time during the year when Daylight Saving Time begins, represented as Unix Time. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone. Units: s.

12.title: DST End
12.description: The precise date and UTC time during the year when Daylight Saving Time ends, represented as Unix Time. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

13.title: DST Offset
13.description: The amount by which the UTC offset changes when Daylight Saving Time is in effect, represented as ISO 8601 time offset format. A DST offset of one hour is represented as "01:00"

14.title: Uptime
14.description: Number of seconds since the last reboot of the device. Units: s.

15.title: RFD device
15.description: Set to true if the device is a Reduce Functional Device running on battery.

3411:1.1.title: Battery
3411:1.1.description: The uCIFI battery object provides attributes to monitor battery level and activity. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.1 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Battery
items.description: The uCIFI battery object provides attributes to monitor battery level and activity. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.1 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

1.title: Battery level
1.description: Level of charge of the battery in % of total possible charge. Units: /100.

2.title: Battery capacity
2.description: Nominal capacity of the battery in Ampere hour. Units: Ah.

3.title: Battery voltage
3.description: Level of charge of the battery in Volts. Units: V.

4.title: Type of battery
4.description: Describes the type of battery (e.g. Li-Ion rechargeable).

5.title: Low battery threshold
5.description: Threshold below which an event is generated by the device. Units: /100.

6.title: Battery level too low
6.description: Set to True if battery level is below or equal the low battery threshold. Set to False otherwise.

7.title: Battery shutdown
7.description: Indicates that the device has shut down due to battery discharge. Can be reset by central application.

8.title: Number of cycles
8.description: Number of times the battery has discharged and recharged.

9.title: Supply loss
9.description: Applies for battery devices that are also connected to mains supply. Set to True when mains power is lost. Set to False when mains power is back.

10.title: Supply loss counter
10.description: Number of supply losses since last reset.

12.title: Supply loss reason
12.description: Reason identified by the device why the device has lost mains supply (e.g. lightning if the device measured a high voltage, accident if the device identified a move with an accelerometer).

5518.title: Timestamp
5518.description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

6042.title: Measurement Quality Indicator
6042.description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROBABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future extensions. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

6049.title: Measurement Quality Level
6049.description: Measurement quality level reported by a smart sensor. Quality level 100 means that the measurement has fully passed quality check algorithms. Smaller quality levels mean that quality has decreased and the measurement has only partially passed quality check algorithms. The smaller the quality level, the more caution should be used by the application when using the measurement. When the quality level is 0 it means that the measurement should certainly be rejected.

6050.title: Fractional Timestamp
6050.description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms). Units: s.

3413:1.1.title: uCIFI Generic Actuator
3413:1.1.description: The uCIFI generic actuator may be used for any actuator but not to replace Outdoor Lamp Controllers nor for an Irrigation Valves which have a specific device type in the uCIFI data model. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.1 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: uCIFI Generic Actuator
items.description: The uCIFI generic actuator may be used for any actuator but not to replace Outdoor Lamp Controllers nor for an Irrigation Valves which have a specific device type in the uCIFI data model. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.1 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

1.title: Default dimming level
1.description: Default dimming level that the generic actuator applies when the device is powered ON. Units: /100.

2.title: Dimming level
2.description: Actual dimming level (0 for OFF and 100% for ON) measured on the actuator. Units: /100.

3.title: Command
3.description: Command (e.g. manual override, scheduler) sent to the actuator. Units: /100.

4.title: Command in action
4.description: For devices connected on slow LPWAN networks, the command in action (this resource) may differ from a command that was sent (resource ID: 3). The command in action is the actual value of the command in action in the actuator. Units: /100.

5.title: Scheduler ID
5.description: The identifier of the schedulers that are assigned to the Command of this actuator.

6.title: Invalid scheduler
6.description: Set to True when one of the schedulers canâ€™t be executed or is not supported by the actuator. Otherwise set to False.

5518.title: Timestamp
5518.description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

6042.title: Measurement Quality Indicator
6042.description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROBABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future extensions. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

6049.title: Measurement Quality Level
6049.description: Measurement quality level reported by a smart sensor. Quality level 100 means that the measurement has fully passed quality check algorithms. Smaller quality levels mean that quality has decreased and the measurement has only partially passed quality check algorithms. The smaller the quality level, the more caution should be used by the application when using the measurement. When the quality level is 0 it means that the measurement should certainly be rejected.

6050.title: Fractional Timestamp
6050.description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms). Units: s.

3414:2.0.title: uCIFI data bridge
3414:2.0.description: The uCIFI data bridge object may be used to transport data from a 3rd party device, operating a proprietary network or protocol, over a LwM2M compliant network. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: uCIFI data bridge
items.description: The uCIFI data bridge object may be used to transport data from a 3rd party device, operating a proprietary network or protocol, over a LwM2M compliant network. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

1.title: Payload
1.description: Content of the message that is to be transported.

2.title: Hash
2.description: Hash to check the consistency of the data payload. Hash mechanism and calculation is vendor-specific.

3.title: Cumulated daily data volume up
3.description: Cumulated volume of data received by the device since beginning of the day. This information could be used for data invoicing. Units: B.

4.title: Cumulated daily data volume down
4.description: Cumulated volume of data sent by the device since beginning of the day. This information could be used for data invoicing. Units: B.

5.title: Cumulated daily data volume total
5.description: Cumulated volume of data sent and received by/from the device since beginning of the day. This information could be used for data invoicing. Units: B.

6.title: Communication error
6.description: Set to True if the device detects a difference in a received payload and the hash.

7.title: Data Priority
7.description: Indicates the Application data priority: 0:Immediate, 1:BestEffort, 2:Latest, 3-100: Reserved for future use. 101-254: Proprietary mode.

8.title: Data Creation Time
8.description: Indicates the data instance creation timestamp. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

9.title: Data Description
9.description: Indicates the data description (e.g. "Meter data").

10.title: Data Format
10.description: Indicates the format of the Application Data. E.g. JSON compressed format from company XYZ.

11.title: App ID
11.description: Indicates the destination application identifier.

5518.title: Timestamp
5518.description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

6042.title: Measurement Quality Indicator
6042.description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROBABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future extensions. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

6049.title: Measurement Quality Level
6049.description: Measurement quality level reported by a smart sensor. Quality level 100 means that the measurement has fully passed quality check algorithms. Smaller quality levels mean that quality has decreased and the measurement has only partially passed quality check algorithms. The smaller the quality level, the more caution should be used by the application when using the measurement. When the quality level is 0 it means that the measurement should certainly be rejected.

6050.title: Fractional Timestamp
6050.description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms). Units: s.

3415:2.0.title: Time synchronization
3415:2.0.description: The uCIFI time synchronization object enables a device to sync-up its internal clock with a remote NTP server. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: false Mandatory: false

1.title: NTP server address
1.description: Hostname or IP address of the Network Time Protocol server.

2.title: Backup NTP server address
2.description: Hostname or IP address of a backup NTP server to be used in case the main NTP server does not respond.

3.title: NTP period
3.description: Number of hours before which the device tries to reach the NTP server for time synchronization. Units: h.

4.title: Last time sync
4.description: Last time at which a successful time synchronization occurred. Units: h.

5.title: Time sync error
5.description: Set to True in case the latest time synchronization operation failed. Set to False in case the last operation succeeded.

3416:2.0.title: Outdoor lamp controller
3416:2.0.description: The uCIFI outdoor lamp controller object provides attributes to control, command and monitor outdoor luminaires in streets, in tunnels, on roads and for illumination of park and gardens. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Outdoor lamp controller
items.description: The uCIFI outdoor lamp controller object provides attributes to control, command and monitor outdoor luminaires in streets, in tunnels, on roads and for illumination of park and gardens. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

1.title: Command
1.description:
Command (e.g. manual override) sent to the outdoor lamp controller from 0 (OFF) to 100 (ON with dimming level = 100%).
A command equal to 67 means ON at 67% dimming level. Units: /100.

2.title: Command in action
2.description:
For outdoor lighting applications, the command in action (this resource) may differ from a command that was sent (resource ID: 1), due to LPWAN network constraints and/or light adjustments within the lampâ€™s control gear (e.g. virtual power settings).
The command in action is the actual value of the command in action in the outdoor lamp controller which could have been set by a manual overide command, a scheduled action (e.g. control program) or any other mechanism. Units: /100.

3.title: Dimming level
3.description: Dimming level (0 for OFF and 100% for ON) measured on the outdoor lamp controller. Units: /100.

4.title: Default dimming level
4.description: The default dimming level that the outdoor lamp controller applies when no schedule nor manual override command is active Units: /100.

5.title: Lamp failure
5.description: Set to True if the outdoor lamp controller detects that the lamp is not producing light while it is expected to (e.g. the lamp is broken).

6.title: Lamp failure reason
6.description: Description of the reason why the lamp failed (e.g. low power on a LED engine, no consumption detected while relay closed).

7.title: Control gear failure
7.description:
Set to True in case the control gear has a failure.
Outdoor lamp controllers may read the control gear failure from a DALI bus or by analyzing a 0-10 volts interface to the control gear.

8.title: Control gear failure reason
8.description:
Description of the reason why the control gear failed.
You may refer to the DiiA list of possible control gear failures.

9.title: Relay failure
9.description: Set to True if the outdoor lamp controller detects that its relay is not operating as it is expected to.

10.title: Day burner
10.description: Set to True in case the lamp is ON while it should be OFF (e.g. day burner).

11.title: Cycling failure
11.description: Set to True if the outdoor lamp controller detects that the lamp is switching ON and OFF too often.

12.title: Control gear communication failure
12.description: Set to True in case the control gear (e.g. LED driver) does not answer on the DALI bus.

13.title: Scheduler ID
13.description: Identifier(s) of the scheduler(s) that are assigned to the Command of this outdoor lamp controller.

14.title: Invalid scheduler
14.description: Set to True when one of the schedulers canâ€™t be executed or is not supported by the outdoor lamp controller. Otherwise set to False.

15.title: Lamp operating hours
15.description: Cumulated number of hours during which the lamp has been ON with a strictly positive dimming level. Units: h.

17.title: Lamp ON timestamp
17.description: Last date and time at which the lamp switched ON, i.e. from no light to light (e.g. power off to power on and/or dim level = 0 to dim level > 0). Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

18.title: Lamp switch counter
18.description: Number of times the lamp was switched from ON to OFF since the last lamp switch counter reset.

20.title: Control gear start counter
20.description: Number of times the control gear was switched from ON to OFF.

21.title: Control gear temperature
21.description: Temperature measured by the control gear and transmitted to the device through DALI, Zhaga D4i or equivalent. Units: Cel.

22.title: Control gear thermal derating
22.description: Set to True if the control gear has derated the light source due to high temperature.

23.title: Control gear thermal derating counter
23.description: Number of time the control gear has derated the light source due to a high temperature, since last counter reset.

25.title: Control gear thermal shutdown
25.description: Set to True if the control gear has shut the light source down due to high temperature.

26.title: Control gear thermal shutdown counter
26.description: Number of times the control gear has shutdown the light source since last counter reset.

28.title: Output port
28.description: Address or reference of the output port (e.g. DALI port address or 1-10 volt output) in case of multiple control gears.

29.title: Standby mode
29.description:
Set to True if the outdoor lamp controller should keep its relay closed (control gear is powered ON) when command and/or dimming level is equal to 0.
Set to False if the outdoor lamp controller should open its relay (control gear is not powered ON) when command and/or dimming level is equal to 0.

30.title: Constant light output
30.description:
Set to True to activate Constant Light Output dimming correction on the outdoor lamp controller.
Set to False to deactivate Constant Light Output.

31.title: Cleaning factor enabled
31.description:
Light output of a luminaire may depend on the lamp cleaning factor.
Cleaning factor may be used as a light output compensation.
Set to True to activate lamp cleaning correction on the outdoor lamp controller.
Set to False to deactivate the lamp cleaning correction.

32.title: Cleaning period
32.description: Number of days after which cleaning factor is back to 100%.

33.title: Initial lamp cleaning factor
33.description: Initial lamp cleaning correction factor to multiply to the command when the luminaire is cleaned, at the lamp cleaning date. Units: /100.

34.title: Lamp cleaning date
34.description: Date at which the luminaire was last (or will be next) cleaned and the lamp cleaning factor should be set to the initial lamp cleaning factor. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

35.title: Control type
35.description:
Type of control system with which the outdoor lamp controller switches, dims and monitors the lamp.
The possible control types are:
0: No dimming control
1 : DALI part 201 - Device Type 0
2 : DALI part 202 - Device Type 1
3 : DALI part 203 - Device Type 2
4 : DALI part 204 - Device Type 3
5 : DALI part 205 - Device Type 4
6 : DALI part 206 - Device Type 5
7 : DALI part 207 - Device Type 6
8 : DALI part 208 - Device Type 7
9 : DALI part 209 - Device Type 8
10 : 0-10V
11 : PWM
12 : PWM_N
13 : Other

36.title: Nominal Lamp wattage
36.description: Active power of the light source at 100% dimming level. Units: W.

37.title: Minimum dimming level
37.description: Minimum dimming level under which the lamp will most probably not operate. Units: /100.

38.title: Minimum lamp wattage
38.description:
Expected active power of the light source at its minimum dimming level.
This value may be used to detect failure at low dimming level. Units: W.

39.title: Light color temperature command
39.description: Latest light color temperature command sent to the lamp actuator. Units: K.

40.title: Actual light color temperature
40.description: The actual light color temperature of the light source. Units: K.

41.title: Virtual power output
41.description: Percentage of nominal power at which the light source should be set when the Command is set to 100%. Units: /100.

42.title: Voltage at max dim level
42.description:
Voltage level on the control port that corresponds to maximum dimming level.
This applies only if Control Type = 0-10V. Units: V.

43.title: Voltage at min dim level
43.description:
Voltage level on the control port that corresponds to minimum dimming level.
This applies only if Control Type = 0-10V. Units: V.

44.title: Light source voltage
44.description: Voltage (usually DC voltage) to the light source or generic load, measured at the output of the control gear. Units: V.

45.title: Light source current
45.description: Current (usually DC current) delivered by the control gear to the light source or generic load, measured at the output of the control gear. Units: A.

46.title: Light source active power
46.description: Active power of the light source or generic load, measured at the output of the control gear. Units: W.

47.title: Light source active energy
47.description: Cumulated active energy consumption of the light source or generic load, measured at the output of the control gear. Units: kWh.

48.title: Maximum light source current
48.description: Maximum current (usually DC current) the control gear is able to deliver to the light source or generic load, measured at the output of the control gear. Units: A.

49.title: Default fade time
49.description:
Fade time to be applied to dimming commands when no schedule nor manual override command is active, particularly managed by DALI control gears.
Default = 0 Units: s.

50.title: Manual override start time
50.description:
If the current timestamp is greater than the configured start time and below the configured end time, the manual command specified in resource 1 is applied, overriding any schedule. Otherwise, if no schedule is currenlty active, the default values of dimming, color temperature and fade time would be restored.
Default = 0 Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

51.title: Manual override end time
51.description:
If the current timestamp is greater than the configured start time and below the configured end time, the manual command specified in resource 1 is applied, overriding any schedule. Otherwise, if no schedule is currenlty active, the default values of dimming, color temperature and fade time would be restored. Setting this resource to 0 would in fact clear any pending override command. If this resource is not explicitly written, the device shall adjust this resource according to the default duration (when the command will expire).
Default = 0 Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

52.title: Manual override fade
52.description:
Fade time to be applied when an override is in progress. If set to NaN or a negative number, the value would be ignored.
Default = 0 Units: s.

53.title: Manual override default duration
53.description:
If a manual command is applied without specifying a corresponding end time, the default duration is applied and the end time, if supported, is changed accordingly.
A value of 0 can be considered vendor specific.
Default = vendor specific (e.g. 7200) Units: s.

54.title: Manual override active
54.description: Indicate if a manual override is currently active on the device

55.title: Default Light color temperature
55.description: The default color temperature level that the outdoor lamp controller applies no schedule nor manual override command is active. (kelvin) Units: K.

56.title: Driver operating hours
56.description:
Cumulated number of hours during which the driver controlling the LED pannel has been powered.
This resource MUST be used as a direct mapping for the Control Gear Operating Time extracted from the Memory bank 205 of any D4i driver being connected to the DALI bus, and supporting DALI part 253 Units: h.

58.title: Manufacturer GTIN
58.description: GTIN associated to the driver manufacturer as retrieved from DALI Memory Bank 0

59.title: Manufacturer Serial Number
59.description: Identification number associated to the driver manufacturer as retrieved from DALI Memory Bank 0

60.title: Firmware Version
60.description: Firmware version of the bus unit

61.title: DALI Version
61.description: Version of DALI implementation as a string (to allow future extensions)

62.title: Unit temperature
62.description: Temperature associated to the Control Gear in Celsius Degrees as per DiiA specification Units: Cel.

63.title: Device capabilities
63.description:
Bit mask of supported capabilities:
bit 0: Power Supply
bit 1: Memory Bank 1 Extension
bit 2: Energy Reporting
bit 3: Diagnostic
bit 4: Sensor Ready
bit 5: Sensor Ready Extended Diagnostic
bit 6: Sensor Ready Power Type: Total Energy
bit 7: Sensor Ready Power Type: Apparent Energy

5518.title: Timestamp
5518.description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

6042.title: Measurement Quality Indicator
6042.description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROBABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future extensions. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

6049.title: Measurement Quality Level
6049.description: Measurement quality level reported by a smart sensor. Quality level 100 means that the measurement has fully passed quality check algorithms. Smaller quality levels mean that quality has decreased and the measurement has only partially passed quality check algorithms. The smaller the quality level, the more caution should be used by the application when using the measurement. When the quality level is 0 it means that the measurement should certainly be rejected.

6050.title: Fractional Timestamp
6050.description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms). Units: s.

3418:2.0.title: Electrical monitor
3418:2.0.description: The uCIFI electrical monitor object provides attributes related to the analysis of electrical consumption in an outdoor luminaire or in a streetlight cabinet. It also identifies electrical anomalies. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Electrical monitor
items.description: The uCIFI electrical monitor object provides attributes related to the analysis of electrical consumption in an outdoor luminaire or in a streetlight cabinet. It also identifies electrical anomalies. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

1.title: Supply voltage
1.description: Electrical voltage supplied to the device. Units: V.

2.title: Supply current
2.description: Electrical current supplied to the device. Units: A.

3.title: Frequency
3.description: Frequency of the supply current to the device. Units: Hz.

4.title: Active power
4.description: Active power consumed by the device and its electrical load. Units: W.

5.title: Power factor
5.description: Power factor is equal to active power divided by apparent power. The value is between -1 and  1.

6.title: Cumulated active energy
6.description: Cumulated number of Wh measured by the device and its load since last energy counter reset. Units: Wh.

8.title: Low power factor threshold
8.description: Threshold below which the device should trigger a low power factor event.

9.title: Low power factor
9.description: Set to True if the power factor is below threshold. This is an absolute value threshold.

10.title: Low power threshold
10.description: Threshold below which the device should trigger a low power event. Units: W.

11.title: Low power threshold at low dim level
11.description: Threshold below which the device should trigger a low power event. This is an addition to the low power threshold to allow a separated threshold when dim level is low. Units: W.

12.title: Low power
12.description: Set to True if the power is below threshold. Vendor may consider the Low power threshold at low dim level to set this resource to True, taking into account the lamp dim level.

13.title: High power threshold
13.description: Threshold above which the device should trigger a high power event. Units: W.

14.title: High power threshold at low dim level
14.description: Threshold above which the device should trigger a high power event. This is an addition to the high power threshold to allow a separated threshold when dim level is low. Units: W.

15.title: High power
15.description: Set to True if the power is above threshold. Vendor may consider the High power threshold at low dim level to set this resource to True, taking into account the lamp dim level.

16.title: Low current threshold
16.description: Threshold below which the device should trigger a low current event. Units: A.

17.title: Low current
17.description: Set to True if the current is below threshold.

18.title: High current threshold
18.description: Threshold above which the device should trigger a high current event. Units: A.

19.title: High current
19.description: Set to True if the current is above threshold.

20.title: Low voltage threshold
20.description: Threshold below which the device should trigger a low voltage event. Units: V.

21.title: Low voltage
21.description: Set to True if the voltage is below threshold.

22.title: High voltage threshold
22.description: Threshold above which the device should trigger a high voltage event. Units: V.

23.title: High voltage
23.description: Set to True if the voltage is above threshold.

24.title: Critical inrush threshold
24.description: Threshold above which the device should trigger a critical inrush event. Units: A.

25.title: Critical inrush current
25.description: Set to True if the inrush current is above threshold.

26.title: Minimum inrush Current
26.description: Minimum inrush current since last configuration. Units: A.

27.title: Maximum inrush Current
27.description: Maximum inrush current since last configuration. Units: A.

28.title: Latest inrush Current
28.description: Latest inrush current measured since last time the relay switched ON. Units: A.

29.title: Reactive power
29.description: Instantaneous reactive power measured by the device and its electrical load. Units: var.

30.title: Reactive energy
30.description: Cumulative reactive power measured by the device and its electrical load since last energy counter reset. Units: varh.

31.title: Low power threshold at custom dim level
31.description: If the measured power when the dimming is between "Custom dim level min range" and "Custom dim level max range" is below this threshold, a low power alarm is set. Units: W.

32.title: High power threshold at custom dim level
32.description: If the measured power when the dimming is between "Custom dim level min range" and "Custom dim level max range" is above this threshold, a high power alarm is set. Units: W.

33.title: Custom dim level min range
33.description: Custom dimming range (lower bound) to allow specification of finer grain thresholds and alarms. Units: /100.

34.title: Custom dim level max range
34.description: Custom dimming range (upper bound) to allow specification of finer grain thresholds and alarms. Units: /100.

35.title: Dimming level
35.description: Dimming level associated to current measurement. Units: /100.

5518.title: Timestamp
5518.description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

6042.title: Measurement Quality Indicator
6042.description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROBABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future extensions. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

6049.title: Measurement Quality Level
6049.description: Measurement quality level reported by a smart sensor. Quality level 100 means that the measurement has fully passed quality check algorithms. Smaller quality levels mean that quality has decreased and the measurement has only partially passed quality check algorithms. The smaller the quality level, the more caution should be used by the application when using the measurement. When the quality level is 0 it means that the measurement should certainly be rejected.

6050.title: Fractional Timestamp
6050.description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms). Units: s.

1.title: ON lux level
1.description: Lux level below which the photocell switches its relay ON or sends a switch ON message on the network. Units: lx.

2.title: OFF lux level
2.description: Lux level above which the photocell switches its relay OFF or sends a switch OFF message on the network. Units: lx.

3.title: Photocell status
3.description: Set to True if lux level is below ON lux level. Set to False if lux level is above OFF lux.

5518.title: Timestamp
5518.description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

3421:2.0.title: Single-phase electrical meter
3421:2.0.description: The uCIFI single-phase electrical meter measures the electrical consumption of loads on one electrical line, such as electrical cabinets in city infrastructures, street lighting networks, homes and buildings. 17.description: Active power export. Units: W.

26.description: Active energy export (unified rate). Units: Wh.

28.description: Active energy (|+A|-|-A|) Combined total. Units: Wh.

30.description: Reactive energy export (unified rate). Units: varh.

31.title: Reactive energy QI (+Ri) Un
31.description: Reactive energy QI (+Ri) (unified rate). Units: varh.

32.description: Reactive energy QII (+Rc) (unified rate). Units: varh.

33.description: Reactive energy QIII (-Ri) (unified rate). Units: varh.

34.description: Reactive energy QIV (-Rc) (unified rate). Units: varh.

35.description: Apparent energy import (unified rate). Units: VAh.

36.title: Apparent energy export Un
36.description: Apparent energy export (unified rate). Units: VAh.

39.description: Time threshold for long power failure. Units: s.

40.description: Duration of last long power failure. Units: s.

41.title: Threshold for voltage sag
41.description: Threshold for voltage sag. Units: V.

42.description: Time threshold for voltage sag. Units: s.

44.description: Duration of last voltage sag. Units: s.

47.description: Time threshold for voltage sag. Units: s.

1.title: Default status
1.description: Default status (level of opening of the valve from 0 to 100%) that is applied when the device is powered ON. Units: /100.

3.title: Command
3.description: Command (e.g. manual override, scheduler) sent to the irrigation valve. Units: /100.

4.title: Command in action
4.description: For devices connected on slow LPWAN networks, the command in action (this resource) may differ from a command that was sent (resource ID: 3). The command in action is the actual value of the command in action on the irrigation valve. Units: /100.

5.title: Scheduler ID
5.description: Identifiers of the schedulers that are assigned to the Command of this irrigation valve.

6.title: Invalid scheduler
6.description: Set to True when one of the schedulers canâ€™t be executed or is not supported by this irrigation valve. Otherwise set to False.

5518.description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

6042.title: Measurement Quality Indicator
6042.description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROBABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future extensions. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

6049.title: Measurement Quality Level
6049.description: Measurement quality level reported by a smart sensor. Quality level 100 means that the measurement has fully passed quality check algorithms. Smaller quality levels mean that quality has decreased and the measurement has only partially passed quality check algorithms. The smaller the quality level, the more caution should be used by the application when using the measurement. When the quality level is 0 it means that the measurement should certainly be rejected.

6050.title: Fractional Timestamp
6050.description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms). Units: s.

3430:2.0.title: Global Navigation Satellite System
3430:2.0.description: More than a positioning object, the uCIFI global navigation satellite system object provides all the information required to calculate a position/location. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: false Mandatory: false

0.title: Fix timestamp
0.description: Timestamp of when the location measurement was performed. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone. Units: s.

1.title: Latitude
1.description: Decimal notation of latitude, e.g. -43.5723 [World Geodetic System 1984]. This value ranges from [-90, 90]. Units: lat.

2.title: Longitude
2.description: Decimal notation of longitude, e.g. 153.21760 [World Geodetic System 1984]. This value ranges from [-180, 180]. Units: lon.

3.title: Altitude
3.description: Altitude above mean sea level in meters. Units: m.

4.title: Speed
4.description: Horizontal speed calculated by the device. Units: m/s.

5.title: Heading
5.description: Direction that the device is following Units: deg.

6.title: Radius
6.description: Radius of a circular area corresponding to the locationâ€™s uncertainty (GPS data precision). Negative values indicate that the radius is not available. Units: m.

7.title: HDOP
7.description: Horizontal dilution of precision.

8.title: VDOP
8.description: Vertical dilution of precision.

9.title: Estimated horizontal accuracy
9.description: Estimated horizontal accuracy. Units: m.

10.title: Estimated vertical accuracy
10.description: Estimated vertical accuracy. Units: m.

11.title: Estimated speed accuracy
11.description: Estimated speed accuracy. Units: m/s.

12.title: Estimated heading accuracy
12.description: Estimated heading accuracy. Units: deg.

13.title: Fix type
13.description:
Possible values are : 
					0 = No fix
					1 = Autonomous GNSS fix
					2 = Differential GNSS fix
					3 = GPS PPS
					4 = RTK-fixed
					5 = RTK-floated
					6 = Estimated fix
					7 = Dead reckoning fix
					8 = Manual input, surveyed
					9 = Simulated mode
					If no fix is possible, but assisted position is provided, value can be returned as 8 = Manual input

14.title: Fix dimension
14.description:
Possible values are: 
					0,1 = no fix
					2 = 2D fix
					3 = 3D fix 
					As per NMEA-0183 GSA.

15.title: Used satellites
15.description: Number of satellites used for the fix.

16.title: Visible satellites
16.description: Number of satellites viewed. Represent all the satellites seen but some of them cannot be in use (e.g. bad signal).

17.title: Satellite identifiers
17.description: Identifier of the satellite.

18.title: Satellite identifiers
18.description: Elevation of the satellite. Units: deg.

19.title: Satellite azimuth
19.description: Azimuth of the satellite. Units: deg.

20.title: Almanac
20.description:
Validity of the almanac. Possible values are: 
					0 = invalid
					1 = valid
					.

21.title: Ephemeris
21.description:
Validity of the ephemeris of each satellite. Possible values are : 
					0 = invalid
					1 = valid
					.

22.title: Signal-to-noise ratio
22.description: Strength of the signal for each satellite, also called carrier-to-noise. Units: dB.

23.title: GNSS
23.description:
GNSS used for the fix. A mask is used with the following bit definition:
					0 = GPS (USA)
					1 = GALILEO (EU)
					2 = GLONASS (Russia)
					3 = BeiDou (China)
					4 = QZSS (Japan)
					5 = IRNSS/NAVIC (India)
					A 0 indicates that the GNSS is not used a 1 indicates it is used.

24.title: Hardware RTC
24.description: Time of the internal clock of the GNSS hardware. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone. Units: s.

25.title: Assisted GPS
25.description: Set to True if the almanac is obtained via a cellular connection. Set to False otherwise.

26.title: Power command
26.description: Command to switch the hardware ON or OFF and status of the device.

29.title: Expected latitude
29.description: Expected latitude configured by the user. Ignored if 0 or NaN Units: lat.

30.title: Expected longitude
30.description: Expected longitude configured by the user. Ignored if 0 or NaN Units: lon.

31.title: Expected altitude
31.description: Expected altitude configured by the user. Ignored if 0 or NaN Units: m.

32.title: Expected location threshold
32.description: Distance threshold from the expected location beyond which the location changed resource will be set. Ignored if 0 or NaN Units: m.

33.title: Out of position
33.description: True if the current position is distant more than the configured threshold from the expected location

34.title: Assisted latitude
34.description: Assisted latitude configured by the user, to be used in case of no coverage. Ignored if 0 or NaN Units: lat.

35.title: Assisted longitude
35.description: Assisted longitude configured by the user, to be used in case of no coverage. Ignored if 0 or NaN Units: lon.

36.title: Assisted altitude
36.description: Assisted altitude configured by the user, to be used in case of no coverage. Ignored if 0 or NaN Units: m.

1.description: Set to True if the parking place is occupied. Set to False if the parking place is free.

2.title: Duration
2.description: Number of seconds since the parking place is occupied. If not occupied, duration shows the duration of the last occupation. Units: s.

3.title: Daily Duration
3.description: Cumulated occupation time since beginning of the day. Units: s.

4.title: Forbidden parking detected
4.description: Set to True if the vehicle present on the parking place is not authorized. Set to False if parking place is free or if the vehicle is authorized.

5.title: Type of Sensor
5.description: Type of sensor (e.g. PIR, camera).

3432:2.0.title: Traffic Counter
3432:2.0.description: The uCIFI traffic counter provides vehicle counting and traffic analysis data. A traffic counting device may implement multiple instances of this traffic counter object, each of them being in charge of counting different categories of vehicles (e.g. bikes, cars, trucks). LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Traffic Counter
items.description: The uCIFI traffic counter provides vehicle counting and traffic analysis data. A traffic counting device may implement multiple instances of this traffic counter object, each of them being in charge of counting different categories of vehicles (e.g. bikes, cars, trucks). LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.title: Vehicle type
0.description:
Identifies the Vehicle type(s) detected in conformance with DATEX II v3 specifications.
The resource instance ID used here should match, the remaining resource IDs under this object for measurement taken by the device for the specified vehicle type. 
Instance 0 of this resource is reserved for Vehicle type = 1 (Vehicle of any type)

0=Vehicle normally used for agricultural purposes, e.g. tractor, combined harvester etc.
1=Vehicle of any type.
2=Articulated bus
3=Articulated trolley bus
4=Articulated vehicle.
5=Bicycle.
6=Bus.
7=Vehicles designed and constructed for the carriage of passengers and comprising no more than eight seats in addition to the driver's seat, and having a maximum mass ("technically permissible maximum laden mass") not exceeding 3.5 tons (M1).
8=Caravan.
9=Car or light vehicle.
10=Car towing a caravan.
11=Car towing a trailer.
12=Vehicle normally used for construction or maintenance purposes, e.g. digger, excavator, bulldozer, lorry mounted crane etc.
13=Four wheel drive vehicle.
14=Vehicles with a total weight above 3,500 kg (vehicle and load).
15=Heavy goods vehicle with trailer
16=A transporter for heavy duty (usually with abnormal dimensions).
17=Vehicle whose weight means it should be classed as a heavy vehicle
18=High sided vehicle.
19=Vehicles for the carriage of goods and having a maximum mass not exceeding 3.5 tonnes (class N1).
20=Large car
21=Vehicles for the carriage of goods and having a maximum mass exceeding 3.5 tonnes (belonging to class N2 when not exceeding 12 tonnes, otherwise class N3).
22=Light goods vehicle with trailer
23=A heavy lorry that is longer than normal.
24=Lorry of any type.
25=Metro
26=Vehicles designed and constructed for the carriage of passengers, comprising more than eight seats in addition to the driver's seat, and having a maximum mass not exceeding 5 tonnes (class M2).
27=Moped (a two wheeled motor vehicle characterized by a small engine typically less than 50cc and by normally having pedals).
28=Motorcycle.
29=Three wheeled vehicle comprising a motorcycle with an attached side car.
30=Motorhome
31=Motorscooter (a two wheeled motor vehicle characterized by a step-through frame and small diameter wheels).
32=Passenger car
33=Small car
34=Vehicle with large tank for carrying bulk liquids.
35=Three wheeled vehicle of unspecified type.
36=Trailer.
37=Tram.
38=Trolley bus
39=Two wheeled vehicle of unspecified type.
40=Van.
41=Vehicle (of unspecified type) towing a caravan.
42=Vehicle with catalytic converter.
43Vehicle without catalytic converter.
44=Vehicle (of unspecified type) towing a trailer.
45n=Vehicle with even numbered registration plate.
46=Vehicle with odd numbered registration plate.
99=Unknown.
100=Other than as defined in this enumeration.

1.title: Cumulated number
1.description: Cumulated number of vehicles counted since last reset.

3.title: Cumulated number today
3.description: Cumulated number of vehicles counted today.

4.title: Measuring period 1
4.description: Time period 1 during which the counter shall provide number of vehicles (e.g. 1 hour). Units: s.

5.title: Measuring period 2
5.description: Time period 2 during which the counter shall provide number of vehicles (e.g. 15 minutes). Units: s.

6.title: Measuring period 3
6.description: Time period 3 during which the counter shall provide number of vehicles (e.g. 5 minutes). Units: s.

7.title: Cumulated number during last period 1
7.description: Cumulated number of vehicles counted during the last period 1 (e.g. 1 hour).

8.title: Cumulated number during last period 2
8.description: Cumulated number of vehicles counted during the last period 2 (e.g. 15 minutes).

9.title: Cumulated number during last period 3
9.description: Cumulated number of vehicles counted during the last period 3 (e.g. 5 minutes).

10.title: Average speed during last period 1
10.description: Average speed measured on the vehicles during the last period 1 (e.g. 1 hour).

11.title: Average speed during last period 2
11.description: Average speed measured on the vehicles during the last period 2 (e.g. 15 minutes).

12.title: Average speed during last period 3
12.description: Average speed measured on the vehicles during the last period 3 (e.g. 5 minutes).

13.title: Average distance during last period 1
13.description: Average distance between two vehicles measured during the last period 1 (e.g. 1 hour).

14.title: Average distance during last period 2
14.description: Average distance between two vehicles measured during the last period 2 (e.g. 15 minutes).

15.title: Average distance during last period 3
15.description: Average distance between two vehicles measured during the last period 3 (e.g. 5 minutes).

16.title: Speed limit threshold
16.description: Speed limit threshold used to calculate the percentage of vehicles above speed limit.

17.title: Percentage above speed limit
17.description: Percentage of vehicles driving above speed limit.

5518.description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

6042.description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROBABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future extensions. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

3433:1.1.title: Noise sensor
3433:1.1.description: The uCIFI noise sensor reports a noise measurement in decibel. It also provides resources for minimum/maximum measured values and the minimum/maximum range that can be measured by the noise sensor and some specific alarms resulting from noise analysis by the device. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.1 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

3434:1.1.description: The uCIFI people counter provides people counting information using Bluetooth beacon or any other method. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.1 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

2.title: Daily number of persons

3.title: Cumulated number of persons
3.description: Cumulated number of persons detected by the device since last reset.
