3435:2.0.title: Filling level
3435:2.0.description: The uCIFI filling level sensor measures how full and/or how empty a container (e.g. waste, fuel) is and reports it either in percentage or in centimeters. The filling level sensor may be complemented with a temperature sensor to compose a waste filling sensor that can also identify waste container fire. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Filling level
items.description: The uCIFI filling level sensor measures how full and/or how empty a container (e.g. waste, fuel) is and reports it either in percentage or in centimeters. The filling level sensor may be complemented with a temperature sensor to compose a waste filling sensor that can also identify waste container fire. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

1.title: Container height
1.description: Height of the container. Units: cm.

2.title: Actual filling percentage
2.description: Percentage of container filled with content. Units: /100.

3.title: Actual filling level
3.description: Height of content in the container. Units: cm.

4.title: High threshold
4.description: Threshold above which the container is considered full. Units: /100.

5.title: Container full
5.description: Set to True if the actual filling percentage is above the high threshold.

6.title: Low threshold
6.description: Threshold below which the container is considered empty. Units: /100.

7.title: Container empty
7.description: Set to True if the actual filling percentage is below the low threshold.

8.title: Average filling speed
8.description: Average percentage filled per day. Units: /100.

10.title: Forecast full date
10.description: Next date at which the container should reach the high threshold. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

11.title: Forecast empty date
11.description: Next date at which the container should reach the low threshold. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

12.title: Container out of location
12.description: Set to True if the container is not at the location where it should be.

13.title: Container out of position
13.description: Set to True if the container is not in correct upright position.

14.title: Container width
14.description: Width of the container. Units: cm.

15.title: Container installation type
15.description: Type of the container. Examples are underground, above ground. Units: cm.

16.title: Container volume max
16.description: The maximum volume available in the container for waste items. Units: m3.

17.title: Filling sensor position
17.description: The position of the filling sensor inside the container.

18.title: Type of materials
18.description: The type of the materials the container can be filled with. Examples are plastic, glass.

19.title: Filling operations counter
19.description: Total amount of filling operations performed.

21.title: Cover open
21.description: Set to true if the cover of the container is open and the filling level cannot be estimated. This is valid if the filling level sensor is installed under the cover of the bin.

22.title: Temperature alarm
22.description: Set to true if the sensor detects a fire using either a temperature sensor object.and/or a gas detection object.

23.title: Water infiltration alarm
23.description: Set to true if the sensor detects water infiltration or a high humidity level.

5518.title: Timestamp
5518.description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

6042.title: Measurement Quality Indicator
6042.description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROBABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future extensions. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

6049.title: Measurement Quality Level
6049.description: Measurement quality level reported by a smart sensor. Quality level 100 means that the measurement has fully passed quality check algorithms. Smaller quality levels mean that quality has decreased and the measurement has only partially passed quality check algorithms. The smaller the quality level, the more caution should be used by the application when using the measurement. When the quality level is 0 it means that the measurement should certainly be rejected.

6050.title: Fractional Timestamp
6050.description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms). Units: s.

3442@1.1.title: LwM2M v1.1 Test Object
3442@1.1.description: This object aims to make easier to do interoperability tests about LWM2M v1.1. It contains resources for each available datatype. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: LwM2M v1.1 Test Object
items.description: This object aims to make easier to do interoperability tests about LWM2M v1.1. It contains resources for each available datatype. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

4.title: Arguments List
4.description: List of Arguments from last execute on "Exec With Arguments"(3) resource. This resource is not affected by "Randomize values"(1) executable resource.

6.title: Resources to Send
6.description: List of path to LWM2M node (Object / Object Instance / Resource / Resource Instance) used by "Send Data "(5) resource. This resource is not affected by "Randomize values"(1) executable resource.

150.title: Opaque Value
150.description: Initial value must be the bytes sequence "0123456789ABCDEF" (Hexadecimal notation).

160.title: Time Value
160.description: Initial value must be the time to an 1st, 2000 in the UTC time zone. (Timestamp value : 946684800) Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

170.title: ObjLink Value
170.description: Initial value must be a link to instance 0 of Device Object 3 (3:0).

180.description: Initial value must be a the "</3442>".
180.title: CoreLnk Value

1110.title: Multiple String Value
1110.description: Initial value must be 1 instance with ID 0 and value "initial value".

1120.title: Multiple Integer Value
1120.description: Initial value must be 1 instance with ID 0 and value "1024".

1125.title: Multiple Unsigned Integer Value
1125.description: Initial value must be 1 instance with ID 0 and value 2^63 (9223372036854775808).

1130.title: Multiple Float Value
1130.description: Initial value must be 1 instance with ID 0 and value "3.14159".

1140.title: Multiple Boolean Value
1140.description: Initial value must be 1 instance with ID 0 and value "true".

1150.title: Multiple Opaque Value
1150.description: Initial value must be 1 instance with ID 0 and value "0123456789ABCDEF"(Hexadecimal notation of the bytes sequence).

1160.title: Multiple Time Value
1160.description: Initial value must be 1 instance with ID 0 and value 1st, 2000 in the UTC time zone (Timestamp value : 946684800). Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

1170.title: Multiple ObjLink Value
1170.description: Initial value must be 1 instance with ID 0 and value "3:0".

items.description: RFC 6690 link, see https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6690.html

1180.title: Multiple CoreLnk Value
1180.description: Initial value must be 1 instance with ID 0 and value "</3442>".

10243:2.0.title: Single-Phase Power Meter
10243:2.0.description:
This Object provides the information to represent a generic Single-Phase Power Meter.
     LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Single-Phase Power Meter
items.description:
This Object provides the information to represent a generic Single-Phase Power Meter.
     LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

2.title: Serial Number

4.title: Tension

5.title: Current

7.title: Reactive Power

8.title: Inductive Reactive Power

10.title: Apparent Power

11.title: Power Factor

12.title: THD-V

13.title: THD-A

14.title: Active Energy

15.title: Reactive Energy

16.title: Apparent Energy
16.description: Apparent Energy Units: kVAh.

10260:2.0.title: RDB
10260:2.0.description: This object allows manipulation of Runtime Database variables. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: RDB
items.description: This object allows manipulation of Runtime Database variables. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.title: Key
0.description:
The name of the RDB variable that this instance currently represents. Writing to this resource will not rename or otherwise modify the associated RDB variable, rather it will re-assign the instance to represent a different variable. Units: 
        .

1.title: Value
1.description:
The current value of the RDB variable associated with this instance. Reading this resource will return a "Not Found" response code if the associated variable does not exist. Writing to this resource will create the associated variable if it does not already exist. Units: 
        .

2.title: Exists
2.description:
Indicates whether the RDB variable associated with this instance currently exists. Writing FALSE to this resource will delete the associated variable if it exists. Writing TRUE to this resource will create the associated variable if it does not already exist. Variables created by this resource will be initialised to an empty string. Units: 
        .

3.title: Persistent
3.description:
Configure whether or not the RDB variable associated with this instance will be saved to persistent storage. Units: 
        .

10308:2.0.title: AT&T Connectivity Extension
10308:2.0.description: The AT&T Connectivity Extension Object will be used to gather information describing the UE and the operating state of the UE. The AT&T Connectivity Extension Object is an open and standard object used by AT&T. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: AT&T Connectivity Extension
items.description: The AT&T Connectivity Extension Object will be used to gather information describing the UE and the operating state of the UE. The AT&T Connectivity Extension Object is an open and standard object used by AT&T. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 2.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

1.title: ICCID
1.description: T he ICCID resource is used to identify the UICC used by the IoT device or module for authentication by the network. Reference ITU-T recommendation E.118

2.title: IMSI
2.description: The IMSI resource is used to log the IMSI used by the UE to identify itself to the network. The IMSI is defined in 3GPP TS 23.003 and is a combination of MCC (Mobile Country Code), MNC (Mobile Network Code), and MSIN (Mobile Subscriber Identification Number).

3.title: MSISDN
3.description: The MSISDN resource will indicate the MSISDN as assigned, if any, to the SIM card. In the case that no MSISDN is assigned to the SIM card the response should be zero.

4.title: APN Retries
4.description: The APN Retry multi instance resource will maintain the number of retries the device can attempt to activate a context on a particular APN. This resource should be defaulted to 2 retries. Should a device integrator wish to manipulate this the integrator should be able to do so.

5.title: APN Retry Period
5.description: The APN retry period multi instance resource is the time in seconds between attempting a context activation on the APN. This should be defaulted to 0. Note that the IoT Module will be limited by the number retries and the periodicity of the retries by the DAM requirements in Chapter 28 of the AT&T 13340. The resource is multi-instance to accommodate different periods of retries on different APNs. Units: s.

6.title: APN Retry Back-Off Period
6.description: The APN Retry Back-Off Period is the period between a burst of attempts to activate a context on a particular APN. This resource is intended to be a longer period than the APN retry period to account for limitations on the numbers of times an authentication request can be made with the network. This should be defaulted to 86400 seconds (1 Day). This resource is also a multiple instance resource to accommodate different retry periods amongst different APNs. Units: s.

7.title: SINR
7.description: This is the signal to noise ratio resource. This measurement should be measured over 10 sampled at a 400ms sample rate. Once the 10 samples are averaged the measurement should be reflected in the Signal to Noise Ratio resource. Reference: 3GPP TS 38.215, clause 5.1.

8.title: SRXLEV
8.description: This resource indicates the cell selection receive value. See definition in 3GPP TS 36.304.

9.title: CE_LEVEL
9.description: This resource indicates the Coverage Enhancement Level defined for LTE-M and NB-IoT. The Coverage Enhancement Level is on a range from 0-2. AT&T NB-IoT supports CE MODE A and B (CE LEVEL 0,1,2) and AT&T LTE-M supports CE MODE A (CE Level 0,1).

10311:1.1.title: Solar Radiation
10311:1.1.description: This Object is used to report solar irradiance (SI), i.e. power per unit area received from the Sun in the form of electromagnetic radiation, on a planar surface measured by a pyranometer or similar instrument. A pyranometer measures solar irradiance from the hemisphere above within a wavelength range 0.3 um to 3 um. For example, the application of solar radiation measurement can be meterological networks and solar energy applications. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.1 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Solar Radiation
items.description: This Object is used to report solar irradiance (SI), i.e. power per unit area received from the Sun in the form of electromagnetic radiation, on a planar surface measured by a pyranometer or similar instrument. A pyranometer measures solar irradiance from the hemisphere above within a wavelength range 0.3 um to 3 um. For example, the application of solar radiation measurement can be meterological networks and solar energy applications. LWM2MVersion: 1.0 ObjectVersion: 1.1 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

5518.title: Timestamp
5518.description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed. Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1 st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

5601.title: Min Measured Value
5601.description: The minimum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset.

5602.title: Max Measured Value
5602.description: The maximum value measured by the sensor since power ON or reset.

5603.title: Min Range Value
5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.title: Max Range Value
5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5700.title: Sensor Value
5700.description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor.

5750.title: Application Type
5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string depending on the use case.

5821.title: Current Calibration
5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

6042.title: Measurement Quality Indicator
6042.description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROBABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future extensions. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

6049.title: Measurement Quality Level
6049.description: Measurement quality level reported by a smart sensor. Quality level 100 means that the measurement has fully passed quality check algorithms. Smaller quality levels mean that quality has decreased and the measurement has only partially passed quality check algorithms. The smaller the quality level, the more caution should be used by the application when using the measurement. When the quality level is 0 it means that the measurement should certainly be rejected.

6050.title: Fractional Timestamp
6050.description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms). Units: s.

10479@1.1.title: Cellular Network and Bearer Control
10479@1.1.description:
This LwM2M Object enables monitoring of available network bearers (or Radio Access Technologies - RATs) of cellular networks. Each instance of this Object holds information related to one network bearer incl. the associated PLMN.
An object instance should be created for every RAT available for a PLMN, and for every PLMN visible to the device.
The Object also allows steering the device towards a particular PLMN, or, to a particular PLMN+RAT combination. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: Cellular Network and Bearer Control
items.description:
This LwM2M Object enables monitoring of available network bearers (or Radio Access Technologies - RATs) of cellular networks. Each instance of this Object holds information related to one network bearer incl. the associated PLMN.
An object instance should be created for every RAT available for a PLMN, and for every PLMN visible to the device.
The Object also allows steering the device towards a particular PLMN, or, to a particular PLMN+RAT combination. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.title: PLMN Name
0.description: PLMN name e.g. "Vodafone UK"

1.title: MCC
1.description:
Serving Mobile Country Code. 
As specified in TS [3GPP 23.003].

2.title: MNC
2.description:
Mobile Network Code. 
As specified in TS [3GPP 23.003].

3.title: Network Bearer
3.description:
Indicates the available network bearers. 
More specifically: 
0: GSM
1: TD-SCDMA
2: WCDMA
3: CDMA2000
4: WiMAX
5: LTE-TDD
6: LTE-FDD
7: NB-IoT 
8: 5GNR TDD 
9: 5G-NR FDD 
10: CAT-M
11 - 20: Reserved for other types of cellular network bearers

4.title: Currently In Use
4.description: Indicates if this PLMN and network bearer is currently used e.g. for the current LwM2M communication (true).

5.title: Radio Signal Strength
5.description:
Indicates the average value of the received signal strength indication. The value is expressed in dBm. For the following network bearers the signal strength parameters indicated below are represented by this resource:
GSM:    RSSI
UMTS:   RSCP
LTE:    RSRP
NB-IoT: NRSRP
CAT-M: RSRP
For more details on Network Measurement Report, refer to the appropriate 3GPP  standards, (e.g. for LTE refer to 3GPP TS 36.133). Units: dBm.

6.title: Link Quality
6.description: This contains received link quality  e.g. RxQual Downlink for GSM (range 0...7, refer to 3GPP TS 44.018 for more details on Network Measurement Report encoding), RSRQ for LTE and Cat-M (refer to 3GPP TS 36.214), NRSRQ for NB-IoT (refer to 3GPP TS 36.214).

7.title: SignalSNR
7.description: SINR: Signal to Interference plus Noise Ratio SINR is the ratio of the strength of the received signal to the strength of the received interference signal (noise and interference). Units: dB.

8.title: Coverage Enhancement Level
8.description:
Indicates the Coverage Enhancement Level of the UE in the serving cell. The Coverage Enhancement levels are defined and specified in 3GPP TS 36.331 and 36.213.
		0: Coverage Enhancement level 0
		1: Coverage Enhancement level 1
		2: Coverage Enhancement level 2
		3: Coverage Enhancement level 3
               99: No Coverage Enhancement in the serving cell

11.title: Device Supports Manual Network Selection
11.description:
0=device does not support manual network selection (overwriting automatic network selection)
1=device supports manual network selection

This resource shall only be present in Object instance 0.

12.title: Network Manually Selected
12.description:
0 = device is on automatic network selection mode.
1=  device is on manual network selection mode and the network has been manually selected

This resource shall only be present in Object instance 0.

13.title: Device Supports Manual Bearer Selection
13.description:
0=device does not support manual bearer selection (overwriting automatic bearer selection)
1=device supports manual bearer selection

This resource shall only be present in Object instance 0.

14.title: Bearer Manually Selected
14.description:
0 = device is on automatic bearer selection mode.

1= device is on manual bearer selection mode and the bearer has been manually selected

This resource shall only be present in Object instance 0.

18830@1.1.title: MQTT Broker
18830@1.1.description: This LwM2M Object provides the information to connect to an MQTT Broker i.e. URI, configuration, and keying material. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: MQTT Broker
items.description: This LwM2M Object provides the information to connect to an MQTT Broker i.e. URI, configuration, and keying material. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.title: URI
0.description: URI of the MQTT broker.

1.title: Client Identifier
1.description: MQTT Client Identifier to use when connecting to this MQTT broker.

2.title: Clean Session
2.description: The Clean Session value to declare in the MQTT CONNECT message.

3.title: Keep Alive
3.description: The Keep Alive value to declare in the MQTT CONNECT message. Units: s.

4.title: User Name
4.description: The User Name to declare in the MQTT CONNECT message.

5.title: Password
5.description: The Password value to declare in the MQTT CONNECT message.

6.title: Security Mode
6.description:
Determines which security mode is used
                    0: PreShared Key mode
                    1: Raw Public Key mode
                    2: Certificate mode
                    3: NoSec mode
                    4: Certificate mode with EST

7.title: Public Key or Identity
7.description: Stores the Deviceâ€™s certificate, public key (RPK mode) or PSK Identity (PSK mode).

8.title: MQTT Broker Public Key
8.description: Stores the MQTT Brokerâ€™s certificate, public key (RPK mode) or trust anchor. The Certificate Usage Resource determines the content of this resource.

9.title: Secret Key
9.description: Stores the secret key (PSK mode) or private key (RPK or certificate mode).

10.title: Certificate Usage
10.description:
The Certificate Usage Resource specifies the semantic of the certificate or raw public key stored in the "MQTT Broker Public Key" Resource, which is used to match the certificate presented in the TLS/DTLS handshake. The currently defined values are:
                    0: CA constraint
                    1: service certificate constraint
                    2: trust anchor assertion
                    3: domain-issued certificate

                    When this Resource is absent, value (3) for domain issued certificate mode is assumed.

18831@1.1.title: MQTT Publication
18831@1.1.description: This LwM2M Object is used to configure data reporting over MQTT. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

items.title: MQTT Publication
items.description: This LwM2M Object is used to configure data reporting over MQTT. LWM2MVersion: 1.1 ObjectVersion: 1.0 MultipleInstances: true Mandatory: false

0.description: The source of the data to publish (e.g. </sensors/temp>, or </3303/0/5700>; </3336/0>). If this Resource is empty, the published data are implementation dependent.
0.title: Source

1.title: Broker
1.description: A link to the MQTT Broker Object Instance (OMNA registered Object ID:18830) describing the MQTT Broker to use.

2.title: Topic
2.description: The MQTT topic to publish to.

3.title: QoS
3.description: The Quality of Service value to use when publishing.

4.title: Retain
4.description: The RETAIN flag value to use when publishing.

5.title: Active
5.description: If true or if the Resource is not present, the Device publishes the data pointed by the Source Resource to the MQTT Broker pointed by the Broker Resource using the MQTT topic indicated in the Topic Resource. If false, the Device does nothing.

6.title: Encoding
6.description: A CoAP Content-Format value used to encode the data in the MQTT Publish message. If this Resource is not present or equal to 65535, the encoding of the data is implementation dependent.
